The toothbrush is supposed to have a pressure sensor that stops the brush if you press to hard against your teeth. I’ve tried and I can’t seem to get that to work.Oh, and I really like the color of the toothbrush. The black stands out nicely. However it seems to be impossible to find black replacement brushes so as soon as you need to change the head you move into the two-tone-toothbrush mode.So mixed review from ne on this one. Oral-b is a great toothbrush but I might have been better off spending a little more on a better model.

I had the older version. It was easy to use, great grip. Battery status was easy to see. Turning it on/off only required one press of the button.This model is so disappointing. I thought it would be an upgrade, but it’s nothing but annoyance. I’ve used it for almost a month. The body is slippery to hold when your hands are wet, they are also not comfortable. It’s not easy to tell if the battery is almost out, so there’s a good chance you’ll try to brush and it’ll just stop. To turn the toothbrush off you either have to hold the button or click it 3 times.I am contemplating tearing this apart so I can put the new battery in the old one, and I’ll just chuck this. Waste of $.

As has been repeatedly emphasized by other reviewers, the battery life of the Oral B Pro 1000 leaves a great deal to be desired, and based on its short life and incredibly long charging time, it is difficult to recommend it. Additionally, it is very noisy and the vibration is quite intense. Charging time is a minimum of 22-24 hours, and even alternating days with my other power brush, it seems as though I'm charging it quite frequently. The only reason I kept the Oral B brush is because I like to alternate between a round brush head and the Philips Sonicare style head, which I use with an Aquasonic Black Series device (which has a strong motor and great battery life so far). I much prefer the Aquasonic brush (which I also prefer over the comparable Philips model, excluding their cheap brush heads; fortunately the Philips heads work great with it) which was only $10 more in cost. I got the Pro 1000 on sale for $30, and I wouldn't purchase it again unless it was at least $10 less than that. In the end, if you are set on a round brush head and don't care to spend an extra $200-300 simply for a quiet motor, an accompanying app and a few other bells and whistles, this might be worth it to you. In this reviewer's opinion, it's certainly much better than a manual brush.

reviewTitle: I have used an Oral B electric toothbrush for years...
reviewDescription: My old unit was just not performing. So I purchased this Oral B 1000. BLAH. I did not want to give up on Oral B so after talking to the factory about my complaints (hard to turn on and off, the stalling between 30 second which I could hardly sense) he suggested I go to the Oral B 1500. NIGHT and DAY. Save your money and wait. The performance of the 1500 is entirely different. The brushing is firmer but not harsh. The 1500 is amazing. My teeth feel CLEAN after I use it. Run don't walk to the 1500.

reviewTitle: Not as strong as the Phillips electric toothbrush
reviewDescription: I bought this one as a travel electric toothbrush.  It works ok but does not have the deep cleaning that my Phillips electric toothbrush does.  When I press hard on the Oral B it stops the brush.  I also do not care for the press the on off button three times to turn it off.  The brush goes from fast to slow then off.  All in all it was much cheaper than the Phillips and is perfect for travel.  If it were my one and only I would return.

reviewTitle: Take a good thing and make it worse
reviewDescription: My wife and I have been using the Oral-B brushes for years now.  We've noticed lately that it doesn't hold a charge as long and takes longer to charge, so we thought we would get new ones.  We regret this for the following reasons:The three mode is the most aggravating.  Turn on the brush and you have to click the button several times to turn it off.  I don't see any need for the modes, but pressing several times to shut it off gets old pretty quick.Both mine and the wife's makes a "clattering" sound periodically, for no apparent reason.  I thought it was a problem with mine, but my wife experiences the same thing.  Turning it off and then on sometimes fixes it, but not always. I fully expect this thing to die well before it's time.We always liked our previous brush, but this is a prime example of "if it works, don't fix it"  Sorry Oral-B, when this eventually dies, we'll switch to another brand.
I recently started using the Oral-B Pro 1000 Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush and have found it to be a significant upgrade from manual brushing. I LOVE the 2 min countdown!

reviewTitle: Brush, brush for good dental hygiene!
reviewDescription: This is an easy way to get your teeth clean. It does so in a short period of time. There are easy to follow instructions, and this was recommended by my dental assistant. My only complaint is it is rather noisy. Good value for the price.
By far the best toothbrush I've ever used. The price was perfect. I must admit, it was a little strange--on my first use, but I got use to it.

reviewTitle: Smile - you're going to love this product!
reviewDescription: I don't know why I waited so long but I am so glad that while hanging out on the couch after Thanksgiving dinner will everyone was looking for Black Friday sales somebody mentioned this toothbrush it is wonderful! I bought one for my sister and I bought extra heads for my family!

My dentist recommended I use this electric toothbrush.  It is very convenient & so easy to use. I started using the battery one but it was extremely difficult opening it to change the batteries. When I go to my hygienist, she notices right away how much cleaner my teeth are since using Oral B toothbrushes ( either battery or electric). Definitely important.

reviewTitle: Why didn’t I replace my toothbrush sooner?
reviewDescription: I’ve had an older generation of this toothbrush for years and I regret not replacing it sooner. This affordable, sleek, light, and incredibly effective little brush is a game changer. I look forward to brushing my teeth every day.
Great little  tooth brush. It's all you need . Bluetooth for tooth brush? You don't need that

I decided to replace the old cheap electric brush so started reading reviews of other such toothbrushes. I ordered and have been very pleased with how it agitates the teeth and gums. Almost fun using it.There are a few downsides....the cost of replacement brushes is insane. The agitation which is a good thing really passes water/toothpast down the handle so it is always wet when put back in the charger...hence that has to be cleaned weekly.

This brush makes brushing my teeth not boring anymore. It cleans the teeth much quicker and better then the manual ones. Charging is also quick and convenient. It seems that the quality is very good. It should last for many years of daily usage.

Upgraded to this one after having one that was powered by AA batteries. I Love how long this lasts between charges, and the different speeds. My teeth feel so clean and I Love the quadrant timer feature as well as the rechargeable feature. So happy I purchased.

Our dentist recommended the Oral B for my husband and he has been using it daily.  Will be getting his new implants soon so our dentist wanted to make sure he was cleaning his teeth as best he could.  With the Oral B it has been wonderful.  The charger works great and it is always ready to go!
Definitely gives you a better, deeper, and quicker clean. And you get a better, deeper clean in harder to reach spots in the mouth. Very happy I got this. I should have done it years ago.

My dentist said I was brushing my teeth too hard and really wasn't even getting them cleaned as well as they could be. So he recommended that I get an electric toothbrush. With a pressure sensor, was most important. So after looking at all the options, I choose this one and I've got to tell you- once I tried it - I will NEVER go back to a regular toothbrush!! The cleaning this gives is amazing. Having a touch of OCD & needing things 'cleaned well' - you won't know your teeth weren't 100% clean, until you brush them with this lol.I will say, it takes an overnight to completely charge and stop the blinking green charging light.  The settings also take a bit to get used to. The first one is for regular cleaning. I skipped the second push for sensitive cleaning and clicked it a third time for the 'polishing' setting to finish off.  Excellent!Also the push button to turn it on and off and change the settings is a little tricky to use, especially if your woman who has nails.  But I won't detract stars for that, cause that's a personal thing that I happened to have. Overall, I would highly recommend getting this for exceptional daily teeth cleaning!!

I bought this not sure whether I'd like an electric toothbrush, so not wanting to spend a lot of money.  After almost three years of use I'm happy with the device, except for one thing.  This has "standard" batteries, which I believe means Nicad.  Their life is getting weak at three years of use, and the warning light no longer even comes on before it will stop running due to a low battery.These units are on sale right now, but I'm going to wait for the 1500 to go on sale, which has Lithium Ion batteries.  That should have a longer life if treated properly.  And I did try to treat the Nicad batteries as they should be treated, but it still didn't help.  A reminder of how bad Nicad batteries are.Edit:  I ended up buying the 5000 on sale--it was $15 more than this model also on sale.  After using it I'm upgrading the rating I gave to 5 stars because this works just was well as the more expensive model, which has a lot of unnecessary features that border on frivolous.  Besides the upgraded battery though, the 5000 has three lights to indicate battery charge, as opposed to just one light which will give a warning of low battery if the battery is not near end of life.  You can decide whether those two things (possible battery life beyond three years and three warning lights) are worth the extra $15.  I find it a close call.

reviewTitle: My Mom is In Love with This Toothbrush
reviewDescription: I convinced my mom to get this brush and she is absolutely in love with it. The toothbrush  keeps her teeth so clean, as-well as healthier gums.

reviewTitle: Works well, you may not need all these features.
reviewDescription: Works well. Holds a charge for over a week. Scrubs your teeth without bleeding. I use it on the default setting, don't share it with anyone and don't use any other feature so I can't comment on them.

I’ve been using the same Oral B I’ve had for 10 years (changing brushes, of course!), and it was still running but really, it was time to put it out to pasture. Boy, am I glad I did! I received this new model and it runs like a top! My teeth feel so fresh and clean and the newer brush heads really make a noticeable difference.
These are well made though I do wish they would use better batteries. Every one I’ve had fails because the batteries go bad. The rest of the toothbrush still works fine but the battery goes bad.
This is for myself and my husband. We both like using it as it does a great job of cleaning our teeth. Should have made this purchase earlier. Our Dentist recommended it!
It’s an electric spinning toothbrush and easy to use. Has 3 speeds - just got it and used it only for a day so far.  Perfect, leaves teeth feeling great!

reviewTitle: Didn’t work out of the box
reviewDescription: Battery would barely charge (very very slow speed).  Have a PRO 1500 that works fine, but the 1000 wouldn’t charge right on either charger base and for in excess of 24 hours.When I researched Oral-B, someone noted that the 1500 has a better battery - it looks like that is indeed something to consider.Longtime Sonicare user - never had any functional issues.  Usually replaced for cosmetic reasons (hard water staining).  I do like the circular motion of the Oral-B, but I’m not sure it makes a difference.

I've been using Phillips Sonicare toothbrushes for nearly 15 years. I got tired of spending so much for replacement heads. One day, I was in Rite-Aid and saw their store brand electric toothbrush for only $9. Electric toothbrush technology has improved so much over the years, so I figured I'd give it a try. I was pretty underwhelmed. It was so loud. My teeth didn't feel nearly as clean as they do after using a Sonicare.I came across a lighting deal for the Oral-B Pro while browsing Amazon. I had high hopes for this toothbrush since Oral-B is a direct competitor to Sonicare. Needless to say, I was very disappointed. THIS TOOTHBRUSH IS SO LOUD! My bathroom is right next to my daughters room. I literally can not use this toothbrush at night because it wakes her up! My teeth don’t feel as clean as they did with the Sonicare either. The battery life is terrible as well. The Sonicare would go months between charges whereas this one lasts a week if that. The $9 Rite-Aid brand toothbrush works just as well as the Oral-B Pro and is significantly cheaper.There are only two things I like about the Oral-B vs the Sonicare. The Oral-B is very compact and travel friendly. It’s closer to the size of a regular toothbrush whereas the Sonicare is massive and a pain to pack. Aesthetically, the Oral-B is a much nicer looking toothbrush.After coming from the Phillips Sonicare, I cannot recommend this toothbrush. The Sonicare does take some getting use too. The sonic vibrations create a weird sensation in your mouth.I retired my Oral-B to a drawer and ended up buying a no-name brand Sonic toothbrush. It’s almost identical to the $250 Phillips Sonicare DiamondClean but cost less than $40. I’ve had it almost a month and I love it. Here’s the link: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07MBNMFSL/

Coming from a “Burst” toothbrush, this is a major downgrade.I only purchased this toothbrush because of the many reviews that it had but it seems like those reviews are from people who never owned an electric toothbrush.Initially, the brush head is way too thick — it feels like I’m putting a screwdriver into my mouth.Also, the power button to change the speeds is very hard to press.Due to this, I can’t change the speed settings while the toothbrush is in my mouth.You don’t know what you have until it’s gone.

reviewTitle: Very Slippery. Hard to find on/off switch.
reviewDescription: I needed to replace my Oral-B electric toothbrush. Made a big mistake buying this one. The handle is too slippery, and the on/off switch looks nothing like the picture. A small button that is hard to find. Will be replacing as soon as I find another one.

reviewTitle: A poor replacement for my older version of this toothbrush.
reviewDescription: It works well when you can get it turned on and it's more diffult to turn off.I have essential tremors & this is really hard for me to use.The older version had an on/off button.This just has a place to push that is difficult to push. It's really difficult to find it & push to stop it while it's still in your mouth.If you take it out to look for it, toothpaste flies everywhere.Very poor design, in my opinion.
Since day 1 after using the light would blink as needing charged.  After only two weeks of use it will not turn on at all

I find it very disturbing that this was false advertising.  The box shows 3 modes which is why I bought this product.  The price is very good for this product which being a retired person and living on a fixed income seemed reasonable.  It does not have 3 modes which was the main point of my purchase.  So buyer beware.
I received this maybe a week or 2 ago, and I've had to charge it every couple days. I assume i just got a bad one and they aren't all this bad, but I'm more likely to throw it away than keep charging

The toothbrush handle is too smooth. It slips around in your hand when it gets wet making it hard to turn it off.  I have owed many of these toothbrushes and have not had this problem.  Very disappointed in this design.

Bought this for my dad in September.  It died in January... just outside the return window.  So now it's a paperweight and won't even turn on regardless of the charging situation.  Will not be buying this brand again.

Overall good toothbrush - got this as a replacement for a different oral-b brush that died. Battery life seems average and does a good job cleaning. Only complaint is the button is hard to push which can be kind of annoying when trying to turn it off. Haven't had that issue with other versions.

Purchased this pink spin brush for my college age daughter for Christmas.  She wanted pink and we could not find it in our local stores.  She really likes it!  Gets her teeth clean and is gentle on her gums.
This was a replacement for a 3 year old Oral-B toothbrush.  Pretty basic, but does the job.
Works as it should. I have to push the power bottom extremely hard in order to turn it off and on, sometimes using two thumbs!
I like Oral-B products. This one is OK, it has good power. But I liked my previous model better. On this one, the power button is kind of weird. Not the easiest to maneuver.
Never had one like this with only the rotating brush head. My last oralB had a rotating brush head but also a part that goes up and down.

This is my second Oral-B electronic toothbrush.  First one lasted about 7-8 years before battery quit charging.  I chose this model replacement based on the reviews.  It works well and keeps my teeth clean and my gums from hurting.  Three improvements I'd recommend.  First, put some grips on the handle.  Several reviews mention how it slips from the hand.  My old Oral-B had grips on it.  Even regular old-fashioned Oral B toothbrushes from the store have grips.  But this thing is slick as heck.  Second, you have to hold down the button (while keeping the slippery brush in your hand) for a while before it turns off (because it has three speeds - not sure why anyone needs three speeds to brush their teeth, but if you push the button once or twice you get a different speed).  The old Oral-B you just pushed the button once and it turned off - very simple.  The third suggestion is to have some way to keep crud build-up from accumulating on the charger after brushing.  Was a problem with the old Oral-B and also with this one.  No matter how much you wash it or dry it, you will have crud build-up in 1-2 days on the charger or where you place it.  Anyway, those are improvements and not deal breakers.  I like the brush for the price and it does its job.  I give it 4 stars and not 5 because of the needed improvements.  (I do like that it plugs directly into a regular wall outlet unlike its competitor which requires a USB adapter - that is one reason I stayed with the Oral B).

reviewTitle: Good toothbrush, if a little messy. Lasted 3.5 years
reviewDescription: This review is for a model purchased in February of 2019.This toothbrush is really good at cleaning your teeth and feels good to use. The timer function is not something I cared about, but it was noticeable, which is good if you do care about it. Replacement heads, of which I went through a good amount of, added up to a non-insignificant yearly cost.My major 2 gripes, which is kind of just 1 gripe, is how messy this thing can be. It may be - in part - the heads that I was using (Oral-B Sensitive Gum Care & Oral-B Crossaction), but they are built hollow with a number of openings that allow the froth from brushing your teeth to get inside of the toothbrush head. This can spill out the base of the head onto the handle/your hand if not elevated, which is really annoying.Additionally, when you are finished brushing and wash the head to clean out that froth (I recommend washing or wiping down the handle, too) - no matter how clean you try to get it, there will still be some scum that tends to collect on the charging base.Anyways - after 3.5 years of using this thing, I'm pretty sure the battery is on its way out. The pressure indicator sensor lit up, and when I tried to use it it shut off for good after a couple of seconds. It works again, but the charge doesn't last as long and is very spotty. The soft plastic cover on the front buttons & battery indicator also recently flaked and peeled off, which will eventually expose the electronics inside of the handle (it was stored away from sunlight for those 3.5 years, too) - so battery depletion or not the toothbrush is on its way out. Probably gonna try a different brand.
I ordered this few weeks ago. I liked it initially, but now it hardly last few minutes after overnight charge.  You have to put this on charge all the time.

reviewTitle: It’s a great toothbrush for cleaning your teeth!
reviewDescription: I’ve been using this electric toothbrush for over 6 months now and so far it’s in pretty good shape and works well! I have braces so using most toothbrushes and trying to angle them in a way to clean under the brackets just doesn’t work well, until I tried this electric toothbrush. It has a sleek design and spins extremely fast and it removes most, if not all of the plaque on my teeth, even under my brackets!! The thing is if not well maintained the toothbrush will build up some bacteria along the toothbrush body so cleaning it ever few weeks is extremely helpful. What I don’t like about this toothbrush is that the head wears off about every two months for me so I have to replace it each time. Even though the heads aren’t that expensive it still is kind of annoying to constantly buy them. Overall, I love this Oral-B electric toothbrush and I have already bought one for my wife and and parents!!

reviewTitle: Works better than past power tooth brush
reviewDescription: Rotery motion works better than back and forth of last elect tooth brush
I needed to replace a old oral B and this one works great
I like that it's small head works well in my sons teeth
First electric brush. Very easy to use. Clean very efficiently. Very pleased.
You can’t do better than this Oral B 1000. It’s powerful.
Me gusto mucho,cumple su objetivo, que es dejar mis dientes limpios y reluciente.
Excelente servicio, los cepillos llegaron en óptimas condiciones y en el tiempo estimado.
Haha maybe not dentist clean, but a good clean. Highly recommend!
Great battery life.  Two minute timer makes me brush longer.
This is an excellent addition to good oral hygiene care.

I gave this Oral-B a try and it wasn’t bad at all. The toothbrush is powerful and noise level is standard for Oral-B electric toothbrushes. The only drawback for me is that the handle can and does get slippery since there is no rubber to keep your hands from sliding on a wet handle! Some other reviewers commented that it’s hard to turn off, I did not find that to be a problem. It has 3 speed settings so all you have to do is press and hold the power button for 2-3 seconds and it will turn the brush off (you don’t have to press the button 3-times). I decided to return the item because of the handle being slippery. I found another Oral-B at Costco that has the rubber handles and for only $20 more it comes with 2 power toothbrushes.

I like the shape of the round toothbrush heads.  I use the sensitive heads and the generic brush heads I had on hand fit the electric toothbrush. I purchased this to replace the Oral-B 1000 I had been using for several years as it no longer held a charge and sometimes wouldn't start without placing it on the charger for a few seconds.  I immediately noticed a huge difference in the rotating speed with the new toothbrush.  I guess I didn't realize just how slow my old one had become because it wouldn't charge.  One thing I miss about my previous Oral-b 1000 is the rubber part of the handle.  The new one has no rubber grip and becomes very slippery while I'm brushing.  I have to stop and rinse it off when my hand moves closer and closer to the brush head.  Also, the power button is slightly off so it takes a few tries to turn it off.  It stays charged for a few days, but when the light blinks you really have to put it on the charger or it will stop working very suddenly.  It takes a long time to charge fully (The light will continue to blink while it is on the charger for over a day.) Overall it seems to clean very well.  Occasionally I follow up with a firm manual toothbrush I keep to scrub the backs of my teeth better.  I prefer using an electric toothbrush because it has stopped the progression of a receeding gum line above my top front teeth over the years since I switched to using one.  Overall, I prefer the older version in the same model but this is the new design.

I recently upgraded to the 3 mode version after my old one shot craps after about ten yrs, I love this pro 1000, it holds charge for a week or more. I read reviews fr ppl complaining about having to push the button 3x to shut it off- well it has 3 speeds so hello and the noise level is not that bad, it's electric so hello again lol. It wd be nice if the stand was convex so water didn't pool on it. Forty bucks seamed a bit high for a toothbrush until u look at replacement heads- wow. Other than thart no complaints

reviewTitle: Good brush for the price, but you have to press three times to turn off.
reviewDescription: Oscillating head, which is great. Doesn't have all the "bells and whistles" and bluetooth bs most people don't need. Great price."3 cleaning modes" ?  means three speeds, and you have to cycle through each one just to turn off.I'd return it but my kid doesn't seem to mind. Other than that... good brush for the price!
This toothbrush seems to clean well, neat looking. I don’t like the shut off switch, my older model was better. Hard to turn it off. Otherwise it does the job.

Bought this to replace my old one. The vibration at the 30 Sec marks is very subtle compared to the old one. Barely noticeable. After brushing,  turning is off feels like I strangling it, have to keep pressing the button until it finally yields and stops. The old one worked like a switch,  click and it's off.Very strange but the price was right. Works just as well as the high-priced geeked-out models

My only negative is the battery to me appears to need charging a little faster than I would like, but I still recommend if you just want a good electric toothbrush brush without added app connected monitoring.
Bought one 13 months ago and it died. Had to buy new one. Worth $50 a year??? You decide.

I got this to replace a very old Oral B battery model. I've been using it for about a month now &so far I really like it. The timer function is a nice feature. It helps me make sure I'm brushing long enough. It's a little noisy but it does a good job cleaning my teeth.
It's a good toothbrush cleaning but a little strong and would be better if it had speeds.

To turn off this toothbrush I have to push the off button 3 times. Now that may have something to do with the mode you're in at the time...but as soon as I push button to come on, it's always in the same fast, uncomfortable mode (bangs my teeth around no matter how lightly I hold it against surface of teeth) AND as others have noted, it IS loud.  -- Am returning
Toothbrush is ok…. Was hoping for a little more power. It stalls out if too much pressure applied… might be a safety feature….
Worked great up until this month.  Works if you hold it upside down for about 1 minute.

reviewTitle: Hard to turn on or off.
reviewDescription: I have arthritis in my hand and it is hard to turn off. I turn it off before taking it out of my mouth or it splatters everywhere. My previous electric toothbrush was easier to use. The brush head is also bigger than I am used to.
Charge only last 3 days not 90  the 3modes seem the same.  It does work
Liked the item. Had a problem. Went to website looking for help. The whole website is about sales of oral b products. Used phone number on website and got more sales talk. No help with the problem.
I have to recharge mine every 3 days, quite annoying. The sonic I had lasted much longer.

reviewTitle: Doesn’t come with travel case as stated
reviewDescription: This states that it would come with a travel case but it does not.
This toothbrush is fine, but there’s way quieter ones. And so I would not recommend

reviewTitle: Does not tell you when it needs a charge. Also too long to charge it.As much as 16 hours
reviewDescription: Too long to charge and does not indicate when it does need a charge

I love everything about this toothbrush, except …. When I put it away inside the medicine cabinet, it usually falls out, and I  can’t really say why. I also have to use my thumbnail to turn it off. I cannot just press it and it will be off.  Makes me wonder how long it will last,  “jabbing” my nail into it.  That being said, I love the way it cleans.
Grows tons of mold. super weird it has tons of good reviews.
Control button hard to useVisual charging not availableFavored older model
it was a lttle too strong for me but otherwise good.
Doesn’t hold charge for long.But would buy again

This was my first electric toothbrush and I definitely feel like it cleans my teeth better than I do manually. However, the battery life on this isn’t very long compared to similar products and you may have to spend a lot more time brushing than manually. It’s also extremely loud and I mean very very loud!!! The noice is the main part the company needs to improve on. Otherwise this toothbrush is a decent buy.

reviewTitle: Slippery, button hard to push, pressure sensor worthless
reviewDescription: I'm happy that it is rechargeable. That was the main requirement. But all the reviews that say it's slippery, that's true! Why did they get rid of the grip?? And the button is really hard to push for 5 yr old and grown up alike. I wish I had gotten something different but now we're stuck for a few years
Variable speed is poor.

reviewTitle: on-off button is difficult to locate and use
reviewDescription: After several months of 3x per day use, it still takes me multiple tries to turn this on and off.  The switch is hidden and hard to feel.  I've never had this issue with Oral B electric toothbrushes before.  Suggest customers try a different model in hopes that the switch is different.

I bought this based on all the positive reviews. I was used to a Phillips and thought I would give it a try. I like it far less than the Phillips. Its a very aggressive and loud toothbrush. In fairness it seems like it cleans really well but I do not enjoy brushing with it at all. My entire head shakes when I use it.

After my Aquasonic brush died I decided to try this one. Maybe the aquasonic spoiled me because this one had all the pulsating power of a manual toothbrush on a full charge. I also found it annoying it didn't turn off automatically at the two minute mark. It just did this weird sputtering thing. Definitely do not recommend. Get the black series Aquasonic instead for the same price.

One of the most primitive electric toothbrushes. How did it manage to get rave reviews and must buy lists??1) takes all day to charge. Can only brush once, after that charge again for full day. Cannot carry it out on a weekend without the charger2) supposed to have cleaning, whitening etc modes. There is no clear indication of how to switch between modes and how to tell which mode it is currently in.3) there is timer after 30 seconds ( thank god)… but it does not auto shut off after two minutes.4) have to pull running toothbrush out of your mouth hold it in front and click multiple times to turn it off… apparently it goes into various modes from same switch before turning off… but you cannot tell what mode that might be5) not effective in removing even little bit of coffee stains from drinking black coffeeVery disappointed with this brush. Its barely average. No better than $7 Arm and Hammer…

I had many Oral-B electric toothbrushes before, and they were excellent, but this one has a convex on/off button instead of convex, i.e. it is buried down and you have to use nails or press really hard and decisive to turn it on or off. It is probably a problem with big hands and people with small fingers do not have this problem.

I've had several Braun Oral B toothbrushes and the quality of this model is disappointing. As a former dental assistant, Braun was known for its quality in the dental industry. This toothbrush doesn't reflect that quality. It isn't a solid as the one I replaced, which was an earlier version of this model. The on/off button isn't where the graphic is placed, so I struggle to turn the toothbrush off and on. While I use the genuine Oral B brush heads, they're noisy and don't seem to fit as well on the toothbrush. I won't buy this model again.

I have used Sonicare for years and loved them! But I decided to try another brand after the rechargeable battery died within two years and also to try something new. So I got this one and I don’t like it at all! I thought it was a matter of getting used to something new, but it isn’t. I don’t like the head brush, it is big, yet it does not cover my whole tooth like the show in the commercial: apply it on top of your tooth and it cleans all around it, for me? Not the case, so I have to maneuver around my teeth with would not be a problem if the brush head wasn’t so big. But my biggest shock is how LOUD this is! To compare it to the Sonicare, the Oral B is like using a a blow drier vs a flat iron to do your hair!I wish I could return it but I got it about five days ago and have been using it- I was really hoping it was a matter of getting used to it. I’ll definitely go back to my prior model.

I really wanted to like this toothbrush. It does a good job cleaning but I absolutely HATE the timer. It buzzes and the head stops spinning every 30 seconds. Ill probably go back to my oral b battery powered toothbrush which is a really great toothbrush. I just hate going through all the batteries.

reviewTitle: Okay tooth brush, disappointing charge life
reviewDescription: I thought it was a nice tooth brush at first, but it has a really disappointing charge life. In comparison, I can use my other Philips electric brush for a few weeks, but this one like... a week or two and then flashes red to indicate low battery? Thought I was hallucinating when I last charged it. I hope the $$$ brushes last longer because if they are the same as this $$ brush, I'd be more disappointed.Also only comes with ONE brush head. Just one intended to last 3 months with pricey replacement heads in store for users.

reviewTitle: Functional Toothbrush with Very Slippery Handle
reviewDescription: Purchased this as a replacement for an older Oral B toothbrush which has started acting finicky (sometimes just switches off, and won't re-start until some time on the charger has passed).  The Oral-B Pro 1000 comes with a smooth, cylindrical handle - that when wet/toothpaste covered requires significant grip strength to prevent slipping from your hand (and the resultant spray of toothpaste all over bathroom until switched off).  They've also "improved" the action of the toothbrush so it pauses much more frequently (please wait) - and now  takes twice as many pushes on the switch to turn off.  I'm calling this one a mistake on my part - and will eventually be using it for cleaning the grout in my shower (while wearing rubber gloves).  Oh, and checking to see if my old one can be disassembled to install a new battery.

reviewTitle: Don't Buy It; Get An Older Model
reviewDescription: It has an extremely annoying feature of jolt-vibrating every 30 seconds that you can't turn off. It takes 3 button presses to turn it off. It slips out of your hand when you're using it. I couldn't stand using it after a couple days. I had to buy the old Vitality version with the rubber grip, turns off after one button press, and doesn't do a 30 second reminder, only a 2 minute one. I didn't give it 1 star because it's still a toothbrush that does work as advertised.

reviewTitle: Last 2 I've bought lasted just 2 years each
reviewDescription: Bought one in 2020 and when it broke, another in Jan 2022, which just broke. The first one I had lasted over 10 years. New ones are not durable.

reviewTitle: The on/off switch is poorly designed
reviewDescription: The on/off button is very difficult to use. The button is flush with the handle. It is not really a button since it does not stick out. It is very hard to shut off. I never would have ordered this if I had known.I would not have ordered this item if Zi had known this.

reviewTitle: 9 Months Old and Rubber is Coming Apart - I do NOT recommend this Model
reviewDescription: I have been a die hard Oral B electric toothbrush user for as long as they have been making them.  This is probably my fifth model through the years.  Usually I get 4-6 years out of the models I have purchased in the past from Oral B.  This one though is going to have to be tossed out in less than a year.  For the past month, the rubber continues to rub off while I am brushing and there is a large bubble forming close to the power button.  Note that this defect is deemed normal wear and tear by Oral B even though this product has a two year warranty.  So they offered me a $25 coupon if I bought a replacement from their website.  Oral B stated that hand soaps, hand creams and household cleaning solutions should not be used when brushing your teeth or handling the electric toothbrush.  Interesting, usually I floss before I brush so I always wash my hands, then floss and then brush.  So I think Oral B's response is just status quo and now I will do my due diligence before I purchase a replacement and consider other options beyond Oral B, especially for other brands that may be more expensive initially but have cheaper replacement heads.  Note that my current tooth brush has been giving me great cleanings (I only use the extra soft Oral B brush heads) and I love the timer but I find it unacceptable that this would be showing such extreme signs of wear and it is not even a year old.  Therefore I cannot recommend it and I will not buy an Oral B replacement of this same model.

I got great use and had no issues with this toothbrush for the first month and a half. This past week, the toothbrush would not charge. I followed all the support instructions around cleaning, using a different charger, etc. Nothing worked. It’s unacceptable for this to break in such a short amount of time.

I’ve had this electric toothbrush for about two years. I’ve changed the toothbrush head many times, but the handle started to smell really bad more recently. The smell is coming from the base, where it sits to charge so I think there might be some mold or something building up. Unfortunately, I can’t find a way to open the base up to try to clean it out and I’m also not sure how you could prevent this issue as I usually rinse everything off and sit it out to dry. I had hoped this toothbrush would last much longer, especially since there probably isn’t really a way to truly recycle the plastic or battery.

This is a decent economical electric toothbrush. I would be happy with it except for the fact the battery life is horrible! They recommend keeping it continuously plugged in which I can’t do. So I have to continuously recharge it. It takes 24 hours to recharge! Yes 24 hours!!!! And then it lasts 4-5 days. 4-5 days using it less than 5 minutes a day! I’ve only had it 6 months and am already looking to replace it. Do yourself a favor and buy something else. This is not worth it in the long run.

I recommend getting the cheapest option. This has three settings but it's clunky to switch between each setting. I'd rather just have one setting and be able to turn it on and off. You have to click the on button 4 times to turn it on the highest setting or turn it off. It also doesn't come with a cover for the brush head which is weird.
Thing is a good toothbrush but compared to my Phillips sonicare, the oral B dies twice as fast. Not very impressed and won’t be buying oral B anymore
I have had an Oral B Electric toothbrush before and it was much quieter.  This one vibrates loudly, rather roughly on all 3 settings. I am disappointed.
This toothbrush is ridiculously loud and makes my whole head shake. Feel like I’m brushing my teeth with a drill. Will see if I can return.

My Phillips Electric troothbrush did a 50 second timer on upper/lower/right and left side of my teeth.This thing not only doesn't time out at all.  I recently left if running until the battery died.Really unhappy with this purchase.

It is small and lightweight, but I am regretting buying it. My hands are somewhat stiff from arthritis and when it gets wet, it slips from my hand. Anyone with  normal function of the hands should be very happy with this. The price is good.

This toothbrush didn't work as well as expected. Hard to turn on and off, loud and runs slower then a $10 grocery store battery operated brush. The shipping box was battered as well as box the toothbrush came in...would not recommend. It was a bought as a gift😔
En la descripción dice q tiene temporizador y sensor para evitar cepillado duro, pero no hace nada de eso. A parte del color no veo diferencia con un cepillo electrónico sencillo

I thought I was buying a toothbrush with a timer on it - apparently not or it doesn't work.The toothbrush is excessively noisy - like a car without a muffler.However, it does do a good job of cleaning

Love the toothbrush but it has a very bright and large green blinking light when charging, which lights up the bathroom and adjacent bedroom at night. You’ll need to close the door to the bathroom or use an eye mask.
I bought this same toothbrush three years ago and it was great. This new design has a flaw. The power button is recessed and it makes it difficult to turn on and off. I’m already annoyed 2 days in.
Charged it for 36 hours to get it to work the first time. Been charging the second time for over 12 hours and the green lights still is blinking won’t buy again and do not recommend.
Not what the Oral B used to be.  The on switch very hard to use.  Have to puish deep to make the contact.  Time seems to degrade the making of many things.

reviewTitle: Short-lived plastic brush head holder key.
reviewDescription: The plastic rib on the power unit (handle) that is supposed to hold the brush head body steady wears quickly.  When this happens, the bristles do not rotate (oscillate) as they should, even though the motor runs properly.  Instead, the brush head body itself turns, while the bristles move only a little, or not at all.  I have tried inserting a metal shim in the slot between the plastic rib and the "keyway" in the brush head, but this gives at best a weak, temporary improvement.  Changing out the brush head for a brand new one does nothing to improve the action.

I'd read some comments about how loud this toothbrush is, but, I figured, how loud can it be? The answer is TOO LOUD! I've had probably 10 different electric toothbrushes in the last 20 years, and this is easily the loudest. It's obnoxious!Also, the charge lasts only about a week, and that's too short a time for my use. If you are able to keep it on the charger all the time, that probably doesn't matter.I do like the round head. That shape makes more sense to me than others, which is why I switched.When I buy my next toothbrush, which will be soon, I'll get another Oral B, but it'll be one with a much lower decibel rating.

Toothbrush is nice has power to clean ,  but somehow, after brushing, I don’t feel my teeth are clean and the power button you have to press again and again to turn it off. It’s annoying. and I think the brush is too wide, and I feel my gums are scrubbing.

I am surprised at how loud and clunky this item is. It is not a fun experience. I've used sonicare in the past and you can tell the quality difference. I would spend a bit more $$ and get a better one. I've used the item so I am stuck with it.

reviewTitle: Died on me within a year
reviewDescription: This product worked fine for about a year. Then it stopped functioning correctly. For example, it would come on by itself randomly or I would press the button and it wouldn't go off unless I put it on the charger. Then suddenly it just stopped coming on all together

I have had this toothbrush for a full year and have grown to absolutely HATE it. Like other reviews say, this brush gets so gross. I make it a point to dry my brush off with a towel but even after that, drips of toothpaste come out of the bottom of the brush head and cover the bottom. The power button is hard to press which makes turning it off super annoying. It sounds like a jackhammer and is just so bulky to hold. I hate it and am buying a different type ASAP.

After the batteries in a few Oral-B electric toothbrushes I bought in previous years failed one by one, I'm really reluctant to buy it again if it's not insisted by my wife because its brushing action is what she likes. But I'm totally disappointed to find that it's still using the same old battery. So I don't have much confidence that it will last long. Actually, I myself had switched to another brand back in 2021, whose battery can work for months after one charge and it still going strong now.

reviewTitle: This toothbrush feels loud and cheap compared to Philips Sonicare
reviewDescription: I was persuaded to buy this by the Wirecutter and CNET reviews.  I wish I had not.  It is loud, and feels big, clunky, and cheap.  I'm going back to the Philips Sonicare, which is more expensive but worth it for something I use every day.

I ordered this item because it was highly rated.  After three months it would no longer hold a charge.  It has a two-year warranty for any defects, but you must mail it in at your own cost.  I did not want to spend the cost of mailing, so I decided to avoid the hassle and get a cheaper model.  I bought a new Oral B electric toothbrush for $20 that works perfectly and cleans my teeth as well as the more expensive model.

I try not to give poor reviews, but when I looked at other reviews, I wasn’t the only one. This thing is ridiculously loud and hard. Since we both have used it I have a hard time sending it back. It’s supposed to be one of the best, as my sister the hygienist reassured me. But Oral B, you either gave your crap ones to Amazon or something is wrong. It’s very hard to put something like this in your mouth and feel good about it.

Purchased this to replace an oral-b that lasted 5 years then the battery wouldn't hold a charge anymore. This toothbrush seemed at first to be a good replacement, but the battery life is only about a weeks worth of normal use and the build quality seems much less robust then my pervious Oral-B toothbrush. As Wirecutter's top choice for electric toothbrushes, it feels less so then their other recommendations which are usually spot on. Will not recommend or buy again.

11/2023: Purchased this brush late March & it’s dead as of mid-November. My disposable electric toothbrushes lasted longer than this thing. I will not purchase it again.I have had plenty of electric toothbrushes but never one with a round head. I chose the round head to force me to concentrate on each tooth versus just time for each quarter of my mouth. This brush has a 15 sec timer to nudge you along and as mentioned, the round head helps you focus on working on each tooth/gumline. My dental exams have improved, not to mention my gums. Replacement heads are easy and affordable to come by. My only complaint is that the wand is huge and the unit is loud. Other than that, you can’t beat the price for what you get.
the on off switch has to be held for a moment to funtion which does not feel natural and is hard to hold down if one has arthritis or weak grip.  very unnatural!

I disliked all of it.  I have dropped it at UPS but I have received no notice of this transaction.  Please see if you can find out what has happened to it.  It must not have been scanned by UPS.  I would like to receive my refund soon.Dr. Wilma Miller

I ordered a new product and received one that was used. It came in an open box that was had tape that didn’t stick to hold it shut and I thought that’s fine if the box is damaged cause it’s going to the trash but then I seen that everything was opened and used when I pulled it out the broken box and it also had old toothpaste residue that you can see in the picture. Like what the heck…? Btw everything opened in the pictures is how it came, I didn’t open a single thing.
Got my teeth clean but hated the experience. Philips is unreliable (broke 3 times) but so much gentler.
The worst electric toothbrush I’ve ever come across. I used it twice before tossing it out. Extremely loud. Did not clean nearly as well as my other electric brushes. Bad product.
Decent motor / brush, but after three weeks of use, the battery needs a change every other day.

This is the second Oral B Pro toothbrush i have purchased, neither of them lasted more than 3 months. The latest one I bought June 2023 and it is now the end of August 2023, the battery does not last. During brushing it might start off ok but the speed of the brush diminishes so badly I can no longer brush. I can’t believe all of these high scores, hasn’t anyone else had this problem? This happened to me twice! It’s a waste of money. The two I got were black based and cost $49.99. I think Oral B is buying these ratings, be cautious. I don’t know what else is better out there.

This toothbrush is the cheapest feeling, biggest waste of time ever. At $50, this thing should at LEAST have three replacement heads included, but they don't. I'm surprised the charging station was included. The toothbrugh it was to replace was purchased 11 years ago, came with 5 replacement heads in a very nice closed compartment. First time out of the box and my gums (which are healthy, I was just at the DDS) were bleeding. There is no indicator light to let you know where the buttons for lower settings are. This was no "professional feeling" cleaning. Bad advertising. Never again, I will never buy Oral B products again.

What a piece of junk.  The unit is super loud, so much so that you can't even hear a TV at normal volume while using it.  There is no off button, and you have to use the on button and cycle through all of the speeds in order to turn the unit off.  Used it 6 times and the thing sounds like it's on it's last legs.  Wish it was returnable but I used it...oh well Live and Learn.  So very disappointed...do better Oral-B.

I ordered this Oral B to replace the one I've been using for 7+ years. My old one still works, I just wanted a newer model. Well, newer does not equal better. First of all, it does not sit well on the base. It wobbles, so  I wasn't sure if it was charging. When I was able to use it, I found it to be much louder than my old model. Turning it off and on is also hard. Lastly, it stalls every 15-20 seconds, which was really annoying. Sent it back, will keep my old faithful.
I like this toothbrush, it may not have all that technology but provides a great brush.
It does a pretty good job when you brush your teeth and also massages you gums also.
Overall great! The color and design makes it easier to clean than my previous OralB toothbrush!
I was surprised at how well this Oral-B toothbrush cleans my teeth, I would repurchase it.
We love this toothbrush.  It feels like you just had a cleaning at the dentist...Everyday😁
Relatively a good toothbrush i just buy new head pieces every 3 months as recommended by the dentist
This works excellent, especially for those behind the back teeth that’s hard to get too areas.
deep cleaning.  My tongue can tell the difference.  I would definitely buy again.
Purchase as a gift my son loves it easy to use and brushes good.

reviewTitle: This is a quality item I was pleasantly surprised by the results.
reviewDescription: I needed a brush to compensate for my lack of flossing.  The dental hygienist recommended an electric brush.  I was surprised how weel it worked.  Takes some getting used to but it really works.  My daughter and girlfriend have made this purchased based on my testimony.

THIS IS A REPLACEMENT FOR A SONICARE THAT WAS MANY YEARS OLD.  I LIKE THE SWIRLING HEAD.  BUT...THE TOOTHBRUSH IS REALLY VERY NOISEY.  THE ON/FF BUTTON HARDLY PROJECTS ABOVE THE BODY OF THE BRUSH MAKING IT HARD TO FIND WHEN STARTING OR STOPPING.  STOPPING...THIS IS A 3 SPEED DEVICE - WHY I DON'T KNOW - BUT YOU HAVE TO DOWN SHIFT FROM HIGH TO MEDIUM TO LOW SPEED BEFORE YOU TAKE IT FROM YOUR MOUTH AND AS SAID THE BUTTON IS NOW REALLY EASY TO FIND.  THE REALLY ANNOYING THING IS THAT THERE IS A HOLE IN THE SHAFT BETWEEN THE BODY AND THE BRUSH THAT ACTS AS A DRAIN FOR WATER/TOOTHPASTE AND INEVITABLY GETS ALL OVER THE HANDLE.  I TOSSED THE CARTON AND WRAPPING MATERIAL OR I'D SEND THIS BACK IN AN INSTANT, SO IT GOES TO THE WORKSHOP WHERE I MIGHT FIND ANOTHER USE FOR IT.

Bought this toothbrush as it was the advertised as same product that I purchased 6 years ago. Not only is it a completely different toothbrush, it is very poorly made. Off/on button is not easy to depress and the non-slip grip on the handle has been eliminated making the toothbrush difficult to grip when it gets wet.  Very disappointed and would not recommend purchasing.

reviewTitle: Hard to turn off and on
reviewDescription: This is a replacement for a brush that finally died. That previous model worked great. This one does too when I can get it to turn on. The button is recessed and I have to push really hard to get it to work. Not a fan. I have to hold it in one hand and press with the other while it’s on the counter.

The thing brushes my teeth just fine, but so do all the non-electric toothbrushes I've been using my whole life. I bought this because of the pressure sensor listed all over the product description that would let me know when I'm brushing too hard. No dice - I can push hard enough to bend the brush head (I stopped short of snapping it), and it just keeps on truckin.For some comedy: I think there actually IS a pressure sensor on this product - but it's in the wrong spot. I noticed that when I push hard enough on the BACK of the brush head, the vibrations stop as advertised. When I realized this, I thought maybe I'd just installed the brush head backward. Again, no dice - they're designed to only install one way. I have four brush heads of two different styles, all OEM Oral-B, and they're all aligned in such a way that the pressure sensor will only kick in if you're trying to brush your teeth with the hard plastic back of the brush head instead of, you know, the brush bristles. What a mess.

reviewTitle: Good Brush, but Proctor and Gamble Does Not Support The Product
reviewDescription: This is the third one of these brushes I have bought.  The design of the brush is intended to render the brush obsolete when the battery wears out, which it routinely does in about 2 years.I'm handy, so I have even learned to unsolder and replace the batteries to extend that lifespan.Even then when the replacement battery wore out I purchased another brush.When I received the new brush, I plugged it in, sat it on my vanity and it promptly slid off the surface towards my wall plug and hit a tile floor from a height of over three feet.  After a strong oath, I looked at the charger only to discover that, unlike it's two predecessors, it didn't have the rubber feet installed to keep it in place on a vanity.  There's still a place for them on the plastic casting, they just weren't there.I checked the packaging, and the documentation, and there were no feet to install and no mention of them.So I wrote to Oral-B's customer service.They responded as follows:"We are constantly looking to optimize our products so they provide great quality and meet the needs of our consumers.  We have removed the rubber feet rather than increasing the cost of the product, while still delivering a great value. We do not have rubber feet/grips available to send. "I've purchased 3 of these brushes -- the price has declined from over $100 to less than $40 over that time. So the manufacturer thinks that telling a repeat customer that saving less than 2 cents to create a product that will not sit on a bathroom surface without trying to commit brush-a-cide is in my interest to avoid a price increase on a product where the tooling has been paid for for more than a decade.Willingness to lie about trivia and utter disregard for the customer is disqualifying.  Feel free to buy the brush, but if you need any support at all, know you'll be utterly on your own. P & G does not care about you at all.

Even thought the description indicates it comes with a Premium Travel Case, it comes with no case. For someone that travels a lot, that was one of the reasons I chose this product. I contacted the manufacturer (P&G Oral-B) who told me that the description was incorrect, but not their responsibility and that they would not send me a travel case unless I paid. This is blatant false advertising so will be returning this product.

reviewTitle: Slippery when wet! Impossible to hold on to!
reviewDescription: DONT GET THIS TOOTHBRUSHLol its almost laughable that this toothbrush sucks cause it doesn't have any sort of grip on it to help when any toothpaste run off, water anything goes down the handle when you're trying to brush your teeth. It's incredibly frustrating and so annoying that I need to get another toothbrush. I felt it was a great value  bit now I know why it was cheap when I got it.

I have used Oral B electric toothbrushes for years.  After owning one for approx. 10 years it finally needed to be replaced.  I purchased the Oral B 1000 electric toothbrush from Amazon after looking at reviews.  The toothbrush arrived one day later.  Unfortunately I was not able to charge the toothbrush with the charger that it came with.  Luckily I had the old charger which worked.  I called Oral B and they acknowledged that they are having problems with chargers.  I requested a new toothbrush from Amazon and within 2 days a new one appeared but unfortunately the same problem.  I called Oral B again and they had no clue what to do except to send it back again.  Overall the toothbrush is very good but its very frustrating that I have to use an older, dirty charger!!

I fully charged the toothbrush before using. I brushed my teeth once and put it back on the charger and the charger never stopped blinking to indicate a full charge. I returned the product for a full refund. Something is wrong with the fit of the unit and the charger. It is not a tight fit, therefore I don't think proper contact is ever made. The brushing itself was very good, but not if it won't charge properly in the future.

Switched from Phillips soniccare to this and regret it big time. This thing runs rough and the timer doesn't work. The design is the worst part. Something about it makes spit dribble down the handle and gets all over everything. It's not just me it happens to wife too.  Definitely going back to Phillips and don't recommend you waste your money on this one

There are several things I like about this toothbrush. The rechargeable stand is nice. But the toothbrush head is so small I just don’t feel like I get a good overall clean. It feels like it barely gets around my teeth. This is probably just a preference but my old electric toothbrush just felt like it had better coverage
This toothbrush does a great job of deep cleaning.  The only drawback I've seen is that the handle gets very slippery when wet or when toothpaste gets on it.  Very easy to drop at that point!

Lowest mode is still a little fast and rough, flings my toothpaste off sometimes but it doesn’t hurt. I have really sensitive gums and apply too much pressure when brushing with a manual toothbrush, so the pressure censor on this has helped a lot. Holds charge for a couple days.
Loved it so very much purchased in April 2023 stopped working December 2023. Will not charge doesn't work anymore.
The shape and size of the toothbrush head makes it difficult to reach some of the teeth in the back so I'm still using my Sonicare but I also use the Oral-B a few times a week now.
Brush does a good job of cleaning your teeth. But the off/on button is very hard and awkward to work.

Pros: The charge on it lasts a really long time. So far it's been a week with brushing 2 times a day. It is cleaning my teeth very well.I dont like that it controls how hard I press. That's a preference thoughCons: I still have to use a toothbrush after to brush my tongue properly or I have bad breath still.
This simple toothbrush is fine.  I didn't need anything with more functions.  The power is adequate and the unit doesn't take up much space.  Always remember to floss in addition to brushing!
Cleaning my teeth, of course. It's much sleeker than my old one, which i recently replaced...after 16 years!

I have use Oral B Pro 1000 for many years and  I am happy with the toothbrush. I need to replace it so ordered the exact same toothbrush.  Not only is it louder than the previous one but the switch is recessed.  I am in my 80s and find it more difficult to turn off and on.

reviewTitle: Not what they used to be, not by a long shot.
reviewDescription: These are way lighter than they used to be, feeling cheesy and cheap. That’s not always the case but in this toothbrush IT IS. I’m very disappointed with it. It’s clunky-it’s LOUD-it is what it’s lightness reflects. Would not by this again, wouldn’t take it if it was free, why…bc my teeth are to important to me to leave their care to this inferior product. Done

Previous Oral-B toothbrushes had ridges so you could hold onto the infernal brush without it sliding out of your hand. Now if you want to be able to grip the toothbrush, you'll need to pay more. Time for a different brand!

This brush is way too intense I can’t even use it. It says there’s 4 speeds in the instructions but there’s only 3 and they’re all the same high speed. The toothpaste just flies off immediately it’s so aggressive.

Brush head is very firm. Battery runs low after just a few days.  The pressure sensor doesn't work. The start/stop button could be easier to find when attempting to stop it.Of all the issues, the battery is the worst.
This toothbrush worked great, then totally died after 8 months’ use by one person. Will not charge, will not turn on. Expected better quality.
My spouse has this toothbrush got a few years ago and only charges once every few months but mine will not stay charged!
This device is not even what is printed on the box.. It does NOT have pressure sensor, does NOT have 3 modes and it took longer to turn OFF than it did to brush my teeth.

Ive had my toothbrush for a little over a month. About 2-3 weeks in I noticed the little hole in the front starting to turn have little black stuff. It’s much too small to clean with a q-tip effectively so I tried soap and water to no avail. I thought probably not coming out in my mouth so I’ll clean what I can and it’s probably not a big deal. But then I noticed last week and fuzzy ring around the brush head. Gross! No idea how long that’s been growing or adding filth in my mouth but that’s disgusting. I threw away the brush head immediately. I try to wash my brush head thoroughly and wipe it dry after every use. I even tried to soak the base (which also begins to collect light brown colored filth) with soap and water. Really not happy with this toothbrush and it’s unfortunately pass the return period. I’ll be getting my brush elsewhere that also comes with a cleaning base.

reviewTitle: Toothbrush does not hold a charge
reviewDescription: Toothbrush does not hold a charge. Only lasts 1 brushing session and then dies. Avoid if you want to save your money.

I really wanted to like this but there were two HUGE flaws1. It is so loud it sounds like a chainsaw.2. The vibration on all settings is too intense and truly made me dizzy for hours after.I am returning this.
The button is hard to push in to turn onOther then that the spin head toothbrush are the best choice!As a dental hygienist I recommend to everyone.

reviewTitle: I wish I had gone electric sooner
reviewDescription: I bought this on Cyber Monday, and have been using it pretty consistently for two months now. I was hesitant at first, because of some reviews I read, but I've got to say that I am very happy with this purchase.My dentist recommended that I use an electric toothbrush because I have made my gums receed by brushing too hard, and exposed the nerves at the base of teeth.  Hot, cold, and pressure, especially from brushing my teeth manually was causing pain.  He said that it's virtually impossible to brush your teeth too hard with an electric toothbrush, and since using this one, I would have to say he's right.  I have tried to put a lot of pressure on, and it doesn't hurt my teeth.  I went back to brushing my teeth by hand, and it did, even when I tried not to apply pressure.  I absolutely hated it.  I wish I had bought one of these years ago.  Not only has it vastly improved my brushing experience, but my teeth feel so much cleaner now than they ever did before.  Like others have said, it's that squeaky clean feeling like you just came from the dentist.  It's great!  I had no idea what I was missing before.Some reviewers have complained about battery life.  I usually keep the base plugged in all the time, and I just always return it to the base, so I don't really notice, but the times I have left the base unplugged, it seemed to take a week until it ran slow and needed to be charged.  *At first I thought I had a problem with my battery dying... then I timed it and realized that it pulses every 30 seconds for you to keep track of how long you are brushing.It does not feel like a jackhammer in your mouth unless you bite down on the head.  As I said, I have extremely sensitive teeth, and I think this is much better than brushing by hand.The handle is a bit slippery, but it's really not a big deal.  If you drool, just angle yourself so it doesn't go down your hand.Overall, for the price I paid, I am satisfied with this product.  I like the size and the shape of the head, and angled bristles.  I feel like it really gets every angle, and down to the gumline nicely.My only complaint is that I have never had a toothbrush wear out so fast as this one has.  I have only been using it for 2 months, and it is already really worn out.  The color changing bristles are yellow and less stiff than before.  The replacement heads are pretty expensive, and the package only comes with one.  No replacements.
Does not hold a charge as well as other toothbrushes. Just has the one speed.

works well but very loud. I like that it does not auto turn off too quickly. Also, there are three different speeds which seems somewhat pointless and you have to go through all of them to turn it off.
I like my new Oral B toothbrush because it cleans very well, and the timer indication is helpful. However, it is noisier than I thought it would be.

reviewTitle: On off switch can be challenging
reviewDescription: Toothbrush works great - cleans great, but the on/off switch on this model is a bit challenging.  They should have kept the other switch.
Dislike how noisy it is and it doesn’t have a timer.
I am a little disappointed that this toothbrush seems to stop periodically while using. I have never had a 2 minute indication.
Louder than my previous Oral BOn/Off switch is reset into shaft & takes some practice
I like this one, but it makes too much noise compared to my old one.  This one is nice because it has the timer.  :)

I’ve had a hard time writing this review because in one way this toothbrush does a fabulous job of getting my teeth clean; however, I am not happy that after less than two years of use my $50 toothbrush isn’t working. As I said, the brushing part is fabulous and my teeth feel as though I’ve just had a cleaning at the dentist every time I use the brush. The things that I don’t like at all are: One - the continual flashing green light when the toothbrush is charging. I can’t charge my toothbrush in my bathroom due to lack of counter space and so have it in my bedroom. The flashing green light means that I can’t have it charging when I am trying to sleep. A steady “on” light or even better a light that indicates it’s done charging would be a much better design. Two - the toothbrush indicates when it’s time to switch to a different quadrant of the mouth by slowing and then speeding up again. This is very irritating as it interrupts my flow for brushing my teeth. I always spend longer in each quadrant of the mouth and I wish this feature could be turned off if it’s not needed. The WORST thing; however, is that the toothbrush is no longer charging properly. I can’t even get a full brushing done without the brush losing power. Oral B does offer a 2-year warranty and they are willing to repair the toothbrush but that means that I have to send it in to them and then it will take 7 to 10 days before I get it back. I can’t get along without this brush for up to two weeks. When I explained this to the “advisor” at Oral B they were not at all sympathetic and quoted “standard policy”. So, does that mean I should spend another $50 to get a replacement for the weeks that I need to have this brush or will that toothbrush also fail. I wonder how long these toothbrushes actually last because this one has failed in 16 months. Oral B doesn’t seem to care about standing behind their product. In addition, the first time I tried to contact them via the phone, I sat on hold for 28 minutes and then they hung up on me. If you need to contact them, use “chat”. As usual, this huge company (Procter & Gamble) doesn’t seem to care at all about their customers and only about their bottom line.

reviewTitle: Buy only if you like a noisy jackhammer-like brush
reviewDescription: I regretted buying for myself and my wife. It is my fault because I was convinced after reading a recommendation from NYT and read the positive reviews here. I did not read the low-scored reviews :(It is loud and vibrates too much. It feels exactly what my dentist uses to smoothen my tooth after a filling. I only used it once and will dispose of it because I don’t want my daily brushing experience to be like a dentist visit. I work with small motors for my electronics hobby and I know that there are very smooth and nice sounding motors available. This is plain bad design and inferior parts for me, plain and simple.

reviewTitle: On/off switch too hard to push!
reviewDescription: The pressure required to turn on this toothbrush was so much that it hurt a tendon in my wrist. The switch was not easy to differentiate from the area. In addition, it started on high, which was loud and felt too harsh on my teeth and gums. So, to get it to the right (low) speed, I had to put it in my mouth and struggle to get it to the desired speed. It was hard to shut off, so my wife and I would take the toothbrush out of our mouth while it was still running. We are returning it. We have used OralB electric toothbrushes in the past, and liked them.

I have been using Oral B plain battery operated toothbrushes for years and have always been happy.  I finally decided to purchase an electric one and went with this Oral B 1000 option based on the reviews and my experience with Oral B battery operated brushes over the years.  I was very excited about trying it out, but when I received the toothbrush last Friday, it wouldn't turn on.  No worries, just means I need to charge it.  I left it on the charger from about 9pm Friday evening until about 8am Saturday morning.  No charge.  The toothbrush would not work.  This is pretty basic to operate, but I read the instructions again thinking -- did I place on the base incorrectly?  Does it take longer to charge?  Nope, did everything correctly.  So .... left the brush on the charger all weekend.... still nothing.  Unplugged everything, and today (Monday), I brought the brush, box, etc. and called Amazon to figure out how to return (honestly, never had to return anything to Amazon, so was not sure of the process after I had opened the item).  The customer service person was very helpful and professional and quickly handled the refund as I was not sure I wanted a replacement or maybe consider another option.  She instructed me to just toss the defective device.  Just before I did so, a co-worker happened to walk by and saw the box on my desk, mentioned he has the same one, so I took the brush out of the box to ask him about it.... and the UNPLUGGED toothbrush felt really warm -- REALLY warm.  It was not on, or at least, was not making any noises.  It kept getting warmer!  Long story short, we figured out how to get the bottom off with a screwdriver and basically ended up tearing the insides of the toothbrush apart to get the battery out and broken away from the terminal leads which were soldered to the ends.  The battery was very warm -- almost too hot to touch.  After we got it apart, the brush and battery both cooled back down.  Thank goodness I felt the brush before I just dumped it in the wastebasket as I now believe it would have caught fire!!!  I hesitate to say not to purchase the product as I truly think this was a fluke and not typical of Oral B products in general. But was  truly scary and has me re-thinking using an electric toothbrush at all -- maybe I will just stick with the good old plain battery operated ones!

I previously had an Oral B Vitality, which was great. I wish I had bought another, but I thought the Oral B Pro 1000 would be an upgrade. Wrong!The Oral B Vitality has a large, ridged silicone grip on the back and sides of the toothbrush. This is a helpful feature when brushing if toothpaste and saliva sometimes run out of your mouth down the toothbrush. The power button is silicone covered and because the button is raised above the body of the toothbrush, you can easily find it when you want to turn it off.The Oral B Pro 1000 lacks both of these important features. Instead, it has a smooth plastic body with some slightly recessed divots on the back. For decoration? They don't help you grip the toothbrush. The power button is recessed and very hard to find when the toothbrush is vibrating and slippery with toothpaste and saliva.The Oral B Pro 1000 is more powerful than my old Oral B, but that doesn't make it a better toothbrush. I hate it.

After using other models of Oral B and other types of E-toothbrushes, I would put this pretty low on the list based on a cost/benefit. It is just an basic toothbrush with 3 speeds. My other Oral B was much better, but more expensive and it rusted out. This one you have to hold the power button down or cycle down through the 3 speeds to turn off. I'd say this is equivalent to a disposable electric toothbrush.

I received my new toothbrush and was disappointed it had already been opened and the brush head was missing.  I ordered a pack of four extra brush heads with my order, so I can use the product.  I expected a new, unopened toothbrush.  Just feel let down.  Not going to return it because I need it.  Shouldn’t ship already opened products especially something that goes it the customers mouth.

There are two factors as to why you should buy a Sonicare toothbrush as opposed to this toothbrush.1. For some reason, no matter how I brush, my spit and toothpaste tends to leak out onto the head and handle, which is just annoying as it gets your hands wet and same with the counter or floor.2. The intensity is weak and barely leaves my mouth feeling brushed compared to a sonicare.Do yourself a favor and buy the $100 6100 sonicare toothbrush. Night and day better than this joke of a toothbrush.

reviewTitle: Don't expect the old oral-B quality
reviewDescription: 1.  The black model does not include any kind of auto pressure control - despite the ad description - for this, I am grateful.2 The "mode" switch is worthless - almost invisible - and so are the "modes"-  why can't we have a simple speed control?  Forget the mode gadgets.3.  The toothbrush body is smooth - almost impossible to hold when wet. The older models were ribbed and easy to hold.4.  The oral- b brush heads are way overpriced - about 5 bucks apiece.  -  goo news here - Amazon offers a 20 pack of generic brush heads @ 68 cents apiece. (13 bucks totalHow does a fairly good product go down so fast?

After 6 weeks of use, the toothbrush suddenly stopped mid-use. Thought the charge had run out so I put it back on the charger for 24 hours. It worked fine for a week and then began stopping after 1 minute.  Leaving it on the charger doesn't help. Needless to say, it's going back to Oral-B (and at my expense!). Would give it ZERO stars if possible.
Toothbrush, should have bought a higher quality.
Love the toothbrush but I don't like that is has  to be charged every few days.
This did not disappoint. Very good.
Works very well but no cap for the brush head when not in use.

reviewTitle: Wish I'd bought it sooner but not a fan of the timer "pulse" function.
reviewDescription: Cleans amazing. I noticed a significant difference in my teeth and gums after getting this. Charge lasts a pretty long time. My only gripe is I hate that they made the 30 second timer a pause and pulse in the actual brush motion rather than an audio timer. So each time I brush there's three pauses in brush function. Just a personal pet peeve.
Does the job well
Good brush, nothing special
Satisfied with performance
I am still not used to a electric toothbrush but I think it's working good?
Battery life is good, the three speeds are really annoying, you have to push the button several times just to stop toothbrush. Cleans well.
Unless on sale Amazon prices are too high

shape of handle, thinner on top, thicker on bottom, and completely smooth caused it to keep slipping from my hand.  would stop after 2 minute timer and was difficult to press button again.  I exchanged this $50 toothbrush for a $20 one that was shaped better with ridges, one speed and a timer that didn't turn off brush.

The brushing is just fine, and I guess that's the important thing, but the recessed on/off button is difficult to locate by feel, even more difficult to turn on, and more difficult still to turn off. I have to use my thumbnail to exert enough force even after I find the thing. My old Spinbrush had two raised buttons, a large one for on, a smaller one for off. Very easy to find and operate. Perhaps my old arthritic thumb is the problem, but I bet there are a lot of folks with the same issue. I find it annoying enough that I may have to pass it on to another family member and go back to an easier to use model.
Difficulties with on of button

I enjoyed the product from may 2019 to November 2023. Yesterday the battery stopped charging. Green light flashed quickly and battery doesn't fill up so the toothbrush no longer works. The warranty period is for 2 years only, so that's that. That's what I will expect from my next toothbrush. Not a long-term investment but it's 40 bucks so still probably cheaper than what I would have spent on manual toothbrushes over the course of 5 years. Disappointed I can't do anything to fix it. Will find a place to hopefully recycle the parts.
battery life only one week.

reviewTitle: Good results, but charger died after 3 months
