reviewDescription: I was the last in my family to embrace the electric toothbrush, but over the last six months I’ve been on a personal mission to deny my dentist anything to put on her “watch list,” and this seemed like a good addition to the arsenal.The brush seems well made and I appreciate the easy and water resistant charging system. There is a bit of a learning curve in brushing technique, but now that I have the hang of it, I really do think I’m getting better results over my manual brush. That combined with a dedication to daily flossing that no other human has ever achieved (I’m pretty sure), I fully expect a look of poorly veiled disappointment in my dentist’s eyes as she slowly lowers the drill that just moments ago was quivering in her expectant hands.Edit May 29, 2023I had my dentist appointment. The hygienist said, “There’s really not a lot for me to do in here. Your home care must be excellent.”The dentist high-fived me.  True story.(Please note flossing played a big part in that.)Edit July 9, 2023The waterproof inductive charger is dead after 3 months of use.  My daughter has same model and hers is fine.
I ordered a pink toothbrush and got a blue one, no big deal it works the same but I also intentionally bought myself a blue one also and now it’s a bit of confusion on who’s is who’s.
it’s loud the toothbrush takes up a lot of space on the counter have to press the button multiple times for it to start doesn’t come with a cover but does the job and is affordable
3 stars because my oral-b pro 1000 doesn't have pressure sensor or is defective in not sensing too much pressure.  Other than that it seems to be a great electric toothbrush.
Best toothbrush ever. Love the 2 minute timer. Especially love the 30 second time! Was a great bonus!

reviewTitle: Perfect replacement for my 8-year old Oral B
reviewDescription: This basic Oral-B rechargeable toothbrush is the perfect replacement for my 8-10 year old Oral-B toothbrush. It even fits the same charger (identical model no) so I have an extra to put in my travel bag...
I am so happy brushing with this - and, best of all, my dentist told me my teeth are much better than before I started using this.

reviewTitle: The timer is kind of wonkey
reviewDescription: I've had other electric brushes with a tone or a pause at the end of 30 seconds and shuts off after 2 minutes.  This one vibrates and keeps chugging along without stopping.  Other than that, it does a good job cleaning my teeth.
This is a must have. I buy these for my family all the time. A Oral-B Pro 1000 Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush, helps keep the dentist away.

I gave this to my 19 year old grandson as a Christmas gift and I was prepared to never hear another word about it. To my surprise he said he really like the way his teeth feel so clean after brushing.  That’s a real testimonial from a teenage boy.
Just get it.  If you want clean teeth get this one, trust me.  The best.

reviewTitle: Best Electric Toothbrush on the planet.
reviewDescription: It cleans the teeth and the spin out the tarter between teeth. Love this product.  Will buy an extra incase the world come to an end and this products isn't made any more
The best toothbrush I ever used, It does a great job cleaning my teeth ,A great value.
My daughter has braces and was having trouble cleaning them. This toothbrush has worked great .

First time owning a rechargeable toothbrush, and I don't think much of my choice.  It does have 3 levels, but I have yet to know if a pressure sensor is working.  But it's the noise level that shocks me.  It randomly switches back and forth from an expected level to a very loud rattle.  At first I thought that the brush wasn't inserted correctly, but that was not the problem.  And the little tiny ring that I failed to see and put on the brush right away, also didn't make a difference.  I bought the aqua one, and I bought a pink one for my daughter.  We compared and both of ours make that same switch from one level to a very annoying rattle.  I may be returning one or both after only a week.

I thought I was getting a deal on this but I didn’t realize there are many “levels” of Oral B electric toothbrushes. This one only looks like the one I got at the dentist. The switch doesn’t work right and there are no settings other than on and off.

reviewTitle: Not as good as the Wire review stated.
reviewDescription: Not impressed,  The wire review said this was a very good brush even though it is less money.  I have difficulties with it charging.  The switch is very difficult as I have minor arthritis in my hand.  I switched from a $90 Sonicare and that was much easier to use.  I switched because the Sonicare was leaving some rather large food particles.  The different brushing mechanism on this does a better job but if it does not work because of charging why bother with it.

I needed a new electric toothbrush. Oralb is a respected brand. The description said it has three modes. As far as I can tell it has one. It is noisy and not a comfortable feel on my teeth. It is very difficult to turn off. Most other electric toothbrushes I have had turn off after 2 minutes. This one keeps going! It was supposed to have two brush heads. Only only was in the box. I’m sending it back. On top of that Oralb’s customer service stinks.

reviewTitle: Great if you like to drool
reviewDescription: I've seen other reviews stating this but it seems to make you drool no matter how you use the brush.  It's annoying and messy.

I have used Oral B toothbrush for many years. I replaced my 5 year old model with the Oral-B pro 1000, The on off button is extremely difficult to use. Very hard to push. My wife needs two hands to operate. I tried to contact Oral B consumer report. The phone tree was too long so I never reached a human being. And I didn't want to join the family of Oral B consumers, whatever that is. I don't know if I got a defective model or maybe they are all like this. Its a shame I can't reach someone at Oral B to talk to.

My old Phillips died and I decided to try the Oral B for a change. Love the pink color. It came charged and was easy to put together. I turned it on and it was super loud and super charged. It seemed extremely rough in comparison to my Phillips. I use an electric toothbrush to clean my teeth and better protect my gums. This felt like it might rip my gums apart. I’ve returned it. Maybe mine truly was malfunctioning. I don’t know.

reviewTitle: Not as good as my old Oral Bs...
reviewDescription: I have owned two basic Oral B elecric toothbrushes in the past... not the 100 USD+ ones, but basic.... I always loved them until they did not charge any longer.... This one I find no better than a drugstore battery charged e toothbrush. It is very challenging to turn on and off and so slippery to hold if you are a messy brusher...please try it out in a store before you buy to ensure it is the one for you.

I've used a Sonicare for many years. When my last one bit the dust, I decided to give Oral B a spin.On the plus side, this toothbrush does do a good job of cleaning.On the negative side, it's noisy as all get out and the chubby toothbrush makes it susceptible to leaking while you're brushing. I finally had enough, chucked the Oral B in the garbage and got another Sonicare.

reviewTitle: Rechargeable is right! You'll be doing lots of it.
reviewDescription: I wanted to try round bristles vs. my SonicCare. I know this is an entry level option, but it's almost like they punish you for buying it. 15 hours to charge which lasts 5 brushings. Only the first two are full power; you can feel the power diminish over the next 3. Noisy and rougher than SonicCare. I'd like it for some heavy brushing, but the constant need to recharge makes it not worth it.
Musch use than my old one four years ago, thank you.
Really makes your mouth feel clean if that makes sense
Love this! Works great! Auto timer for quadrant is great!
This brush cleans very well, including reduction of tartar buildup.

I love this toothbrush! I had purchased one that vibrated from my dentist and absolutely hated it. There is NO vibrating just fast rotating head . I love the timing pulse that lets you know when it’s time to move to another area. My teeth feel super clean!  I’m a customer for life!

reviewTitle: Replacement toothbrush after having a Phillips Elite for twenty yrs
reviewDescription: Great product and delivery…:better than I had hoped.
Oral-B is definitely the best electric toothbrush out there!
Great toothbrush - gets the job just right
I’m really happy with this project It’s awesome
It works as expected, no issues so far😉

I thought it was a good price. Have had many Brauns over the years. Easily charged but lacks the power of others even when newly charged. Would recommend spending a little more and going to the 1500 powered one.

reviewTitle: Save money and invest in new tech
reviewDescription: I like it. Is functional but there are better options
Works fine for the short time I’ve had it.
Good except for the on off switch being too recessed which makes it hard to turn on or off.
Didn't dislike anything it cleans your teeth very well
A little noisy but otherwise seems to do well.

reviewTitle: Single charge last four or five days of brushing
reviewDescription: Easy use, and does a good job of cleaning

Pretty good electric toothbrush I needed it to replace my other one that I had previously. I got it for a good price on Black Friday so I figured I’d give it a try. There’s only one setting I thought they were three it’s pretty harsh and pretty fast. I share this with my toddler who does not like the vibration of it as it is too strong, the pros would be it leaves my teeth feeling clean for me. The vibration is not too strong, I just wish there was more than one setting. The box said there was more than one setting, But when I looked it up online, there was only one setting.It comes with a black and white head and a charger like I said for the price it was a good deal. But next time I would like something with another setting.
It seems to be working Great so far!!
I don’t care for the three speed.

This model replaced my old Oral B.  Not happy with this particular toothbrush.  I find the QuadPacer annoying.  Signal to move the toothbrush to another part of your mouth similar to when the two minutes are up.  Personally, I don't need a reminder to move the toothbrush but many seem to have this feature.  The low battery light is not reliable.  Red light came on and then the toothbrush quit.  Not enough advance notice.  Charge lasts only 8 days, not 10 like advertised.  Bought in August and already shopping for a different toothbrush.

reviewTitle: Leaks nasty toothpaste water after usage
reviewDescription: This toothbrush works really well, but has a major design flaw. For some reason I have been living with this toothbrush for 3 years, despite the fact that every time I use it, it slow leaks sticky toothpaste water out the bottom of the base after every use. I had to buy a special holder for it which I have to constantly clean. After finally reading other reviews, I see that others have the same issue, clearly it’s a design flaw. My partner, who uses a sonicare toothbrush makes fun of my nasty toothbrush. 😅 Would not buy again.

reviewTitle: Works well except that it is difficult to switch on and off
reviewDescription: This is an improvement over my older, slightly slower Braun toothbrush with respect to cleaning. The one big problem with it is that the power button does not reliably engage with a normal push.  Turning it off especially requires several seconds of attempts, pushing the button at various angles.  This is very annoying, especially when I am brushing a child's teeth and need to be able to turn the toothbrush off in response to unexpected actions. I do not recommend the product.

We had a different Oral-B brush for a few years, then bought these before xmas 2023.  The battery life is very disappointing.  Takes at least 2 days to charge completely, then sounds strong for a day, then begins to struggle.  Think we got a couple of lemons, but missed the return window.  The battery in the older model worked so much better.  And they sound like single-engine propeller airplanes; I'm hesitant to start the engine while wife is sleeping

I wish I had sent this rechargeable toothbrush back.  I loved my first one. The brush is a tiny round design that fits well into a small mouth. My first one I used for years and loved it, and finally after many years, the battery with no longer charge.  My dentist gave me a battery operated and I like that one also. But this one is rougher but more than that the handle it has a poor design that often on switch is difficult to use because it dents in as opposed to denting out but it’s small, so getting your finger or thumb in to the little indention is difficult. Also, the grip on the handle is not good. My others had some rubber on them so that they did not slip and they this one has little raised places on it. It still falls out of my hand often and of course, hits the hard bathroom floor. This is not the one I would buy again, though I would buy the Oral B because of the tiny round brush… Just not this one.

This Oral B Pro 1000 toothbrush is not as well engineered as the previous version.  The handle is very slippery, especially when wet.  I have dropped the toothbrush twice already.  The ON/OFF switch is indented rather than raised, which makes it very difficult to find and turn off while using the toothbrush.  The three brushing modes are more annoying than helpful, since you generally have to cycle through them to turn off the brush.  You can press and hold the ON/OFF switch to turn off the brush, but it is awkward to do so.  If you can get past the defects, the toothbrush cleans well.

I like this toothbrush it did get the job done but ig it’s not 100% waterproof I mean I feel like it should be since we brush our teeth it will obviously get wet here and there but mine stopped working because a little bit of water got in there which sucks now just feel like I bought this for no reason at this point 🥲😕

I keep buying these, and they only last about a year before they break again.  But I have a lot of the sensitive teeth brushes to fit it, and I hate to get rid of the brush heads and start again with a brush head that doesn't pair with a newer model.This toothbrush is cheap and not study

I had an Oral B 5000 Pro and loved it.  I used it for quite a few years.  Brushing your teeth tends to get a little water down into the unit, it is inevitable, so eventually it started spewing brown yuck.  Obviously I didn't feel it was safe so the 5000 Pro was discarded.  I am in the process of moving and have a back up unit packed away but can't get to it easily so I decided to order a less expensive Oral B model.  Because I need it I am keeping it but it is definitely NOT the same quality as the 5000 Pro.  My 5000 Pro would give a sound when it was time to change brushing locations this one has a little vibration in the handle but it is very hard to determine and you can't turn the unit off and on easily.  It takes 3 clicks to turn it off because it has a weird low medium high setting for brushing.  Extremely disappointed and would NOT recommend this unit.  If you have arthritis this unit is NOT for you.  I'm extremely unhappy but will use it for the time being.  Don't waste your money on this unit.

"I'm not sure if I received a defective product, but the battery life of this toothbrush is disappointing, especially given its price. I bought it as a replacement for another electric brush that no longer offers replacement heads. Despite charging it overnight, I find that it only lasts a single day before needing to be recharged, even though I only brush twice a day. It's puzzling because I'm not leaving it on all day or using it continuously. Additionally, it's quite noisy and feels somewhat outdated. In my opinion, there are better and more affordable options available."

1. I have used this model toothbrush for years and was very satisfied.  I only bought a new one because the battery was failing to fully recharge.  I assumed that any design changes would be to improve the product.  I was wrong.  Every change that I can detect has made it less easily used!a) To improve the grip the old model had rubber like surface down the handle on the "button side" and around the top -- that has been eliminatedb) To improve the grip the old model had ridges above the button -- those has been eliminatedc) To improve the grip the old model had ridges over 60% of the "back" -- the new model has less pronounced ridgesd) The old model button protruded above the handle making it easy to locate by feel, the new model button is flush making it difficult to locate by feelThe first 3 times I used the new brush it slipped through my fingers and I had to use my other hand to push it back up -- that almost never happened using the old brush.It apparently did not occur to the designer that the brush would be used with the brush at the top 50% of the time (brushing upper teeth) and that saliva mixed with toothpaste is slippery and would slide down the handle thus lubricating the grip! Who is the idiot that authorized these changes?

My Oral B Pro 1000 stopped charging after the 2nd use. I called Asurion and they won't help me because the toothbrush is still under manufacturer warranty. Oral B made me take a bunch of pictures of the rechargeable toothbrush, then told me I have to go to the expense to send it back to them with a tracking number. I am disabled and on a fixed income. I will not be able to attempt to send it back for several weeks.  I paid for a 3yr extended warranty, but Asurion won't touch it until the 2 year  manufacturer warranty is up. What a waste of my money. Meanwhile, I am without an electric toothbrush. It is difficult for me to work a manual toothbrush which requires more strength in my hands.

reviewTitle: Junk.  Stopped working after 3 months of use.
reviewDescription: Pretty disappointed in the quality of this product, it stopped spinning after 3 months of use.  I tried putting a new, very expensive brush head on and it still does not spin.  If i had time to waste I'd probably pull the thing apart and fix the thing, but time is money, and I'm just not willing to waste time on the chance that I may be able to repair it.Even when the product worked as expected, I found it to be a little more aggressive than I was expecting.  I've gone back to my cheapie spin brushes that I've grown to love.  The brush heads are far cheaper and I could buy 5+ complete spin brushes for the price i paid for this piece of garbage.I will stay away from Oral B products in the future....just more junk to add to the landfill.
What other product runs for 42 total minutes and requires a FULL 22 HOURS to charge? GTFO I don’t have time for this thing. It’s trash.

My Sonicare died and I read that the circular brushes were better than the vibrating ones so I decided to try this one. It’s super clunky, the brush head is so big I drool when I’m using it, and it dies quickly. I hope that this one dies quickly so I can buy a Sonicare again.

reviewTitle: These rust at the metal  holder of the brush head.  They are my  3rd ones and I DRY them  after use!
reviewDescription: I used sonicare brushes for years but then read a review for Oral-B that said they were slightly better.  I've purchase three in the last  couple years and first  one rusted, then broke right off. I tried them again only to have them start to rust.  I am so disappointed that WIRECUTTER would continue recommending  them
This is too loud. I wanted to experience the round brush. My phillips toothbrush makes a buzzing sound, but this oral b rattles and is much louder. Im sending it back. Will look for another model.

reviewTitle: The charging system did not work.
reviewDescription: The Oral B Pro 1000 did not charge despite being plugged into an outlet for hours/days. The power light flashed for a few minutes but never stayed on for use. I'm returning it for a refund.

reviewTitle: This thing is disgusting! DO NOT PURCHASE UNTIL YOU READ THIS!
reviewDescription: I picked this up hoping it would clean a bit better than the cheap Orbal-B electric I picked up at Walmart for about $20.Oh my GOD. Please do not buy this! I don’t know what they made the handle out of, but unless you want to disassemble your toothbrush everyday and risk soaking a battery in water, do not get this. I don’t know what tf is wrong with it. It STINKS! It’s something about the material. This will smell  like wet dog and dirty socks on day 2. I tried taking it apart every day and disinfecting it but it still smelled absolutely disgusting no matter what I did. I can’t even get it to stop stinking to high hell long enough to charge it all the way.This is an absolute no-brainer of a return. What were you thinking Oral-B?!? Disgusting, awful product! Do. Not. Buy. I’m so glad I didn’t throw away my old electric toothbrush.It doesn’t matter if you soak it in listerine, use disinfecting wipes, bleach, or use a denture tablet soak. It smells terrible and the smell will cover your hands. I was prompted to write this review because I was too disgusted to even wash my face with the same hands that touched the toothbrush, so I contacted support to return it. Thank goodness for Amazon’s return policy!Unless you love the smell of ACTUAL DEATH, avoid at all costs. I picked up the cheap version of the oral b electric awhile ago and the handle grip was light blue instead of black. Find it. Cherish it. Keep it. Run far, far away from this. I never write reviews, but this was terrible enough to deserve one. If I could give it zero stars, I would.

I got this for a replacement of another Oral-B electric toothbrush that I have had for years. Within the first week, this stoped working. I followed the prompts offered by the seller, but it was of no help. I tossed the original packaging a few days after I purchased and because of this, I cannot send it back. I'm unsure if this is just a fluke, but it never feels good to be out almost 50 bucks for something that did not work.

Wirecutter recommend this as their #1 toothbrush, it does a great job I really like it over some others that turn off after your 2 minute timer. I take more than 2 minutes sometimes! It keeps going. Takes little space on counter. Problem is it’s kinda noisy and Wirecutter mentioned this also, but they weren’t kidding, how can this little thing make This much noise?! It also has 3 speeds which is kinda nice!

I am enjoying this electric toothbrush so far. I think it was super affordable and it has an in built timer which is cool but it also has a shock absorber which Let you know that you’re brushing too hard which I think is helpful for me especially if you’re like me, who is always thinking about something else it kind of grounds you

With all the different modes and selections that electric toothbrushes come with I enjoy the simplicity. Of course I can change the speed, but I like that all I have to do is turn it on and just begin to brush without having to think of which mode to use. It's a reasonable price and works very well.

This Oral B electric toothbrush is a replacement for my 10 year old one.  It is really fast and effective.  I'm pleased with this purchase, and I recommend it.  Once you open it, it takes almost 24 hours to fully charge.  So be patient.  But it's worth the wait.

I love this toothbrush. It's the first one that doesn't make me gag or throw up. I can get around all my teeth to ensure they're clean. Love that it's rechargeable. Great product! Could care less about blue tooth connectivity.

This replaces our 20+ year old model…a real improvement over a tired old tool.The multiple settings are great: I like the sensitive mode, she likes the polishing mode so much she gets up early and uses it for ten or twelve minutes.  I know she likes it because I can hear her moaning " yes, yes, ohhhh yessssss" and then she shows off her white teeth with a big smile; and she leaves the brush head wet and sweet (must be the mint toothpaste).Highly recommended by both of us.

El cepillo de dientes eléctrico es de buena calidad, es liviano, suave y tiene buena carga.Posdata: La lista de preguntas obligatorias de Amazon pregunta por longevidad para un artículo recien comprado lo cual no es una pregunta acertada.

reviewTitle: Oral-B Pro 1000 Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush works great
reviewDescription: The Oral-B Pro 1000 Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush works great and is the third Oral-B in our household.Our first one was retired as the battery was declining. Now one in each bathroom for convenience. Good Price, Happy Customer!

This toothbrush is strong and cleans very well. It holds the charge for more than two weeks. We bought this particular toothbrush because we went on vacation and needed it to hold a charge. And it performed!
I have been using a Sonicare brush for several years.  I decided to try the OralB & I’m so glad I did.  It really cleans every tooth.  I know my checkup will be good.

reviewTitle: It does well what it is intended to do.
reviewDescription: I have only had this a few weeks.  A basic model, but does a good job.

I've had this toothbrush for a couple of weeks now and I'm very pleased with it. It does a far better job of gently brushing my teeth than brushing with an ordinary toothbrush. My dental hygenist recommended using an electric toothbrush to prevent gum recession.I like the 2 minute timer feature. The toothbrush beeps every 30 seconds to tell you to switch areas of your teeth and gives a final beep at 2 minutes when you can finish brushing. I ignore the 30 second beeps since I'm moving the toothbrush around anyway, but I always brush at least until the 2 minute beep to make sure my teeth get a good cleaning.I find the on/off button easy to turn on, but it takes two or three attempts to get it to turn off. I don't know why the toothbrush is harder to turn off than on. I like the pink color of the toothbrush in my pink bathroom. The toothbrush came with one brush head that is too hard for my liking, but Oral B offers a 3-pack of sensitive head replacement brushes and I plan to order those.

Bought this when I needed a new toothbrush and didn’t want to splurge for the +100 one. It was a nice cheaper option, but definitely doesn’t feel as sturdy as the more expensive ones. Is doing the job, so if you are looking for a cheap alternative this works, but you are getting what you pay for.

I'm not sure what I was expecting but this toothbrush isn't it. I needed to replace an Oral B electric toothbrush that I've had for years, it was a "higher" model. This model still does a good job brushing, it's just a little rougher than what I am used to.

This is a pretty toothbrush. It cleans my teeth really well. I like it but there a couple of annoyances — it does die quickly. I’d say it should be charged every other day. I also don’t like that it brushes very intensely. It has 3 speed settings and I need it on the lowest to have a more comfortable brush so I have to press the button twice which is also needs a strong push in order to change settings.The timer also seems nonexistent because I was brushing for 4 mins and it still never turned off or do whatever it’s suppose to do?

reviewTitle: Cleans well, but the handle is a poor design
reviewDescription: This is a mechanical toothbrush, and it does what it needs too well enough.Now, what really has bothered me the most, and why this get 4 stars, is the handle. This thing is just so awkward to hold. There's no grip. Brushing your teeth means water will track down the handle, and you'll change your hold every so often. I've almost dropped it a couple times because of this. I'm baffled as to why it's designed this way.

I bought this because Wirecutter recently ranked it the best of all electric toothbrushes - and because it's pink!  I love the timer, which buzzes every 30 seconds, so you know you've brushed each quadrant of your mouth long enough.  Gentle enough on my gums to even use two weeks after oral surgery.  It is a little hard to shut off, though - you really need to press hard, with two hands - which makes it a little difficult for people with weak hands.  That's why I gave it just 4 stars.

reviewTitle: Off button is hard to press
reviewDescription: Off button is very hard to press. Other than that it is great.

Overall it's great. Really great for cleaning. However the on off button is a little weird to push for me. That would be the only thing I'd like to be different. I like that it's rechargeable. The clean feels like you just left the dentist.
The handle is slippery when wet and it’s not easy to shut off

reviewTitle: Third time buying it and it’s not the same
reviewDescription: This is the third time I buy this product over the years. Amazon actually told me first time I bought this was 2017, every couple years I change it with a new brush since charging holds less and less, this time I don’t know what happened because this model is definitely not like the previous years. It’s way slower and like other people mention you have to press the buttons way harder in order to work. I’m not sure why the same model throughout the years lost quality but it’s unfortunate.
This is not a toothbrush that you can use if others are sleeping. It's noisy.
Love this and the color, however I have to charge it every 2 days.
It works ok, I see a small rust after a few days..

I don’t need or want all the bells and whistles (or high price) of the higher end Oral-B rechargeable electric toothbrushes found at Costco and online. This brush effectively gets the job done and came at a good price (under $40).My only issue is the power button. A simple press will turn on the brush, but I need to press firmly for two seconds to turn it off.

reviewTitle: This handle is not ergonomic and super slippery.
reviewDescription: My beloved Oral-B brush finally gave up and it was time to replace it.  I went with this model because it seemed like a minor upgrade, having 30 second interval alerts.  Not that waiting for the 2 minute alert was bad, but sometimes I tend to zone out a little while I brush my teeth.  See, several years ago I decided that all my rage and fury and worry was taking over my life so I devoted the 2 minutes during tooth brushing to thinking about things that bugged me and then moving on with my day.  Seems weird, but it totally worked for me.  Having reminders ever 30 seconds means that I can multi-task and work in extra things to think about.  Don’t make it weirder than it already is.But here’s the problem: this toothbrush has turned into at least 30 seconds of my allotted grumble time.  See, unlike my previous brush, this one doesn’t have any real grip.  Which means if you are brushing your teeth and the brush handle gets wet at all (which it does), you hand will slide up and suddenly you are accidentally gripping exactly where the on/off button lives.  Which means on an average day, I might turn off the brush a couple of times during a two minute brushing session.This gets annoying really fast.The pink color is honestly a little off too.  It is more of a soothing, baby nursery pink or really pale person flesh pink. Kinda gross to be honest. But that is the least of my concerns.But does it brush?  Yes.  It brushes.  The spinning head is perfection and just like the spinning head of my previous electric toothbrush. My dentist gave me high marks for oral hygiene.  But I just don’t love this toothbrush handle, which feels like a weird thing to have feelings about.

I was replacing a 20 yr old, yes, that's right, 20+ year old model of this same tooth brush! I like this one fine, but I find the on/off button hard to find when brushing your teeth. Too subtle, but not a huge deal. I'm sure this one won't last as long, but that's life these days. I would purchase again, but only if on sale. Does the job!

reviewTitle: Much more slippery in use than the original Oral B I had.
reviewDescription: My original Oral B rechargeable electric toothbrush was awesome, but it was no longer holding a charge, so I needed to replace it.This one is fine, but Braun did away with the gripper parts on the base/handle, and now it is just smooth white plastic, and in the 2-minute brushing time, my hand is nearly up by the base of the toothbrush because of the slick surface of the handle. This is just stupid engineering!I didn't need or want all of the bells and whistles this device come with...I just wanted a 2-minute timer and a handle that could be easily gripped during the entire 2-minute brushing period.I do love the circular brushing function of the Braun, and think it does an excellent job of cleaning your teeth and massaging your gums.This rating would have been a five if it wasn't for how slippery the base is.

Perhaps  I am not tech-savvy enough to know where the Timer light is located, therefore 'seen', but how are users told their 2 minutes of cleaning is done? My toothbrush makes a big noise, I keep moving it around my mouth to cover all teeth, I continue while waiting for the toothbrush to stop after it's done the 2 minutes...it seemingly never stops. I am not counting seconds in my head as I brush, not do I have a clock in my bathroom so after a long time, I push the power button off. Have I done the 2 minutes, or not? My oral B electric toothbrush from way-back-when automatically turned off once the 2 minutes were up. There was even a blinking light in sync with the Timer. Does anyone else question this or have a clue as to whether or not this model has a Timer? Maybe we're supposed to keep brushing until we 'think' we've brushed enough, then we manually turn the toothbrush off as I have been doing.

The description states that this toothbrush has 1 mode (Update: Amazon added "3-mode" to the title description, but the long-text description still states 1 mode).  However, this blue model has 3 modes, so you will need to cycle through the modes to turn off, if you're on the highest setting.  This annoys me- I prefer 1 mode.  Also, the power button is recessed, vs. the bubble style of the previous/older model.  The new power button is more difficult to find via feel, and is not as easy to use.  Not a huge fan of this new model.  OF NOTE:  I purchased the black model as well, and the black model has 1 mode!  It seems you may receive a 1 mode toothbrush, or a 3 mode toothbrush, whichever one happens to ship to you-  The toothbrushes are identical, otherwise. The brushing action itself, is very good...  the round brush head enables you to reach in back of your molars very well.

I've been using electric toothbrushes for a while and thought I'd give this one a try. I  like how the toothbrush works, it seems to be doing a good job cleaning teeth without irritating the gums too much. However, I don't feel like applying too much pressure does anything (which is one of the advertised features).  My biggest gripe is how poor is the battery life - 3-4 days while brushing twice a day is the average. Yesterday, the toothbrush stopped while I was brushing my teeth (no red light that would indicate the battery needs charging). My significant other's brush seems to hold a charge much longer. I likely got a dud. Can't say I recommend it.
But that gum pressure control is non existant

reviewTitle: Cleaned great but battery started having issues after a few months.
reviewDescription: I really liked this toothbrush but it isn't working as expected after a few months. I charge it overnight and the battery dies after 2 weeks which is very disappointing.I don't think there is a timer or bluetooth connectivity function on the one I got. Sometimes when brushing it skips then keeps going on. Wish the battery lasted longer.I still recommend it though because the toothbrush does make my mouth feel clean. Very loud and rumbly though.
Very loud compared to other options on the market. Also would not hold a charge for more than 3-4 days.

I have arthritis in my hands and I can’t push switch hard enough to turn on or off. Have to use the handle of a makeup brush to turn it on or off which is inconvenient!  Also it is unbelievably LOUD!  Sounds like a semi-truck is bearing down on you. I have had other Brauns in past but will definitely switch to another brand. (Please publish as Anonymous, and not my full name— too intrusive).

reviewTitle: Disappointed in an Oral-B Pro for the first time
reviewDescription: I've used Oral-B electric toothbrushes for years, and for the most part I've loved them.  One of my only issues is they do to collect...unsightly toothpaste gunk?...and are a challenge to keep clean.I was excited to see that this issue seemed to be solved with this model, as I read in a review, because the bottom is in one piece without crevices to gather such gunk.  However, as I realized immediately when I used it for the first time, the brush keeps slipping out of my hand because there isn't anything to grab onto! I had to stop brushing a few times and reposition it so it wouldn't slip into the sink and make a mess.I was also disappointed that the one setting of this brush (which I decided was fine for me) is very intense, much more than the highest setting of my previous Oral-B model.  AND the brush is actually quite loud.Unfortunately I got a little too excited and threw away my old brush and the packaging for this one before I realized any of this (note to self: stop doing this!)  But I think I'm going to have to suck it up and get a brand new one.Bottom line: I would highly recommend a different model if you're going for an electric toothbrush, even at a higher price point, but I still do love Oral-B brushes in general, so I'm giving this 2 Stars.Here's to oral hygiene!

reviewTitle: Ok - not as good as corded - need to refill mid floss
reviewDescription: This is a disappointing product compared to corded type. The reservoir needs to be refilled to complete a flossing session. The adjustment levels of water strength are not great. The batteries supplied with original purchase wear out quickly (I thought the device would not floss with sufficient water pressure until I replaced the batteries). The on/off switch is awkward to use when turning off with tip in mouth. Stick with corded model.

Too loud. Why so loud. Shhhhh!!!!! You’ll wake the dead with this one. Shakes out ear plugs. They’ll hear you comin, so no need to bring a siren. Huh, what’d ya say? I can’t hear you over the jackhammer toothbrush.

It is a good electric tooth brush.  My only gripe is that you push on the big white part to start the brush action and push the little, slightly indented button to stop the action.  On my very old one by the same company, you pushed on and off in the same spot.

reviewTitle: Sold as new but package was opened.
reviewDescription: This was sold as new but it actually had the box opened and taped shut.

reviewTitle: What's with the on-off function this time?
reviewDescription: Replacing my old Pro 1000 with what I thought would be the same thing,but, somehow, they managed to screw up the on/off button. Imagine takingthe toothbrush out of your mouth and wanting to instantly shut it off. Nope.It's not as simple as pushing the same spot where you turned it on. There's someother mysterious place kinda slightly below it(?) where if you give it a good mashing,it'll finally shut off. Meanwhile, if you have it out of your mouth, you'll end up havingto clean your mirror after it flings toothpaste and spit on it - probably after you're donecussing at the toothbrush to "STOP!"

I had an Oral B pro for a number of years and it finally died.  I purchased the 1000 and though the price was good but I wish I had never purchased it..  The battery life after a full charge is only about a week maybe 8 days.  It goes from fully charged to red light with nothing in between and once it’s red, you’ll get about 2 days before it stops mid-brush.  It does nothing other than brush your teeth.  No timers, no lights to give you a hint about where the battery is, no bluetooth…nothing.  I could have purchased a battery operated one for $20 less.It does a decent job brushing and can utilize multiple Oral B heads so you can pick what works best, but that’s it. It doesn’t even connect to the app.Do yourself a favor and buy the 1500, I wish I did.
The online description did not seem to match the product I received. I was expecting multiple modes, but there was only one mode on my product. It was very loud and overly buzzy in my hand.

This was the third generation oral b i have purchased over last many years.  I’ve alway bought 2 packs. and each pair had one battery  much worse than the other.  Body of this handle is slick, without softer plastic trim to prevent “slippery when wet”', so it has to be held tighter than other versions. This is also the first that doesn’t have a  “pushing too hard” warning. Other versions said to run down battery weekly. This said to keep it charging for 6 months before running it down. Maybe the vendor thinks I will forget the better versions, and I will buy again?

reviewTitle: It's slippery. Slides out of your hand!
reviewDescription: At first  I thought of sarcastic and snarky remarks. But,no. Can one imagine a crack team of Oral B designers making their simplest tooth brush slippery to hold? Well, they have made the Oral B PRO 1000 slippery. Hard to imagine. I know. After all their first brush even had a tactile slightly soft feel. It lasted almost for ever. Now this. You mix water and tooth paste together and you've got a slippery concoction. And, yup, the brush becomes hard to hold. A death grip works! But that's not the way to brush.I'll bet they have something to say about this. Probably, "It isn't slippery." Yeah, well, so "you" say.
Doesn’t last 2 minutes before it pulses and the on/off button is temperamental
Was excited to receive this product and it worked great for the first few days. Unfortunately, within the first week, it stopped holding a charge for more than 30 seconds. Returning it for a refund.

reviewTitle: Very loud and sounds like a cheap toy
reviewDescription: I decided to buy this toothbrush because of the number of reviews, and was very disappointed.The first thing you will notice with this brush is the sound it makes. It's very loud, not the hum or buzzing of past electric toothbrushes. This sounds like a cheap toy. I ran the brush a few times and decided there is no way I could deal with this sound. You may say no big deal, and I would too, but this just seems like junk. I'm returning and going to drop a little more money to get a nice brush.

Unfortunately after 2 years, a recessed component of the base that is impossible to clean accumulated a very foul smelling mold. Since the brush head is hollow it allows saliva to freely enter the base and makes it basically impossible to clean, disappointed that I need to throw it away after multiple cleaning attempts, even though it works just fine. It looks like similar brands of electric toothbrush do not have this issue and have solid heads with no openings.

I used a Fa*rywill toothbrush for a long time and it recently died so I thought I'd try out a new one and this one was on sale. The brush head is too large/round- getting my back teeth causes gum pain because it's just to big to fit back there.  The motor is quite loud. It's also slippery and falls out of my hands sometimes. The buttons don't always push very well either so I find myself stumbling with them, especially when wet. I'd recommend many other better brushes.

reviewTitle: Great Cleaning Action, but Flawed Design
reviewDescription: I previously had a more expensive Sonicare and went to this Oral B.  I think the actual cleaning action of this Oral B brush is great and better than the Sonicare.  For that alone, I'd still pick this brush.  However, the battery life is noticeably worse than the Sonicare, the timer is worse and most annoying there are openings in the brush attachment that will start to stink.  You can just rinse off Sonicare and it won't get gross.  The Oral B has openings on the brush attachment and it'll start to stink if you don't clean where the attachment fits on.  If Oral B fixed this stuff, 5 stars for sure.

Initially was great but lost effectiveness after about 3 months. Needs constant recharging, unable to last 7 days on a full charge. As the months increase more charging is required on a twice day usuage.

reviewTitle: Works Well But Doesn't Hold Charge
reviewDescription: Just got this toothbrush about a week ago and had to charge it twice already. My old toothbrush would go a full month without having to charge. Very dissatisfied with this purchase.
The charging base never worked (yes I cleaned it thoroughly before each use) maybe I got a defective product. The tooth brush itself however worked properly. But won’t be ordering again

This is the 3rd Braun Oral-B rotating head toothbrush I've bought and used. Although I like the pink color, the toothbrush has been cheapened especially when it comes to turning the brush on and off. Instead of a button as on my previous toothbrushes, it has a slight depression that I can't find by feel - I have to look for it. When I find it, I have to use more pressure than one would expect to turn it on and turn it off. Sometimes, I have to press on it twice to get the expected results. In my opinion, the manufacturer needs to return to the button style of on/off switch!

I’ve had a Braun electric toothbrush since the first one came out. I love them. Was gifted a sonic care and my teeth always felt filthy. For this one, I went with the Wirecutter recommendation because it was cheap. I wish I’d just spent the money on a nicer one. It’s something I use at least twice every day so it’s worth the investment. This one is loud and the brush fits loosely so it rattles.  Battery life is very short so for even a long weekend trip I have to take the charger. It does get my teeth really clean. Get a Braun, just spring for a nice one.
Not great. A lot of vibration to the point of being uncomfortable. It states that it has two speeds but both of them are pretty rough on your gums
This product is not comfortable to use.  It's bulky in the mouth.  Not enough speed and strength adjustments  Had a waterpik previously and much prefer.
The grip on this is not at all good, especially when you have saliva and water running down your hand! Wish I had sprung for a different model!
The start button is so small, hard to turn on.  Once on it does a good job. Holds a charge over a week.
This is a quality product! Totally recommend this and a great value for the money!

Bought this for the wife for Christmas , she loves it! We have not used the Bluetooth features, but the toothbrush is great and battery life is superb. It cleans very well and the timer function is nice to make sure you brushing for the appropriate time.
This is easily the best toothbrush I have ever had. Leaves your mouth feeling clean and fresh after using it. Highly recommend.

This is a great toothbrush with a perfect way of letting you know when you have brushed one of the quadrants of your teeth for 30 seconds and its time to move to the next, with a clear reminder that your two minutes are up, although you can continue brushing if you want. It is effective and reliable; what more. Do you need?

reviewTitle: It’s doing a better job than a regular tooth brush
reviewDescription: Has helped me with taking care of my teeth. I can go to the gums in a circular motion without that much effort.
Good cleaning action.  Some people say it's noisy - I don't think so.

reviewTitle: It has levels to how prefer to brush.
reviewDescription: Its nice and the real product if your wondering. Packaging is neat too.
Cleans thoroughly with not to much pressure. Has a lot of power. Charges easily.

reviewTitle: how well it cleans and longevity
reviewDescription: Like product can't answer longevity because have not had long enough to rate,
Came the next day and my husband has used it every day since

I did a little comparison between a few electric toothbrushes today and ended up settling on the name brand. After one use, I’m not sure I made the best choice. I chose it because I trusted the Oral B brand, I preferred the round head, decent charge time, and the reviews. It arrived and I’m not significantly impressed. It came with one brush head, a charger and that’s it- I guess I knew that based on the description, but I was still surprised compared to what others offer. No case for travel, and not even a cap to cover the bristles so they aren’t exposed. It works as intended, but I’m wondering why I spent $40 on an Oral B when there were other brands available with good reviews, good charge times, and 6-8 brush head replacements for half that price- even if they last half the time, it’s already a better deal for your money. Not a noticeable difference between the settings, it just seems like you have to press the button multiple times to get it to stop. And the vibrate pattern to let you know you’re done with your 2 minutes is hardly distinguishable from the 30 second patterns-on a sleepy morning or evening, I could easily dissociate through that warning and end up spending 8 minutes brushing. Also, as someone else mentioned, the “neck” does seem a little too big around. I disregarded that when I was reading reviews, but it’s the first thing I noticed when using it- it makes it harder to put your mouth around it and to move it around. Smaller brush head should require a more dainty neck, you’d think- it sounds strange to need to consider this, but compared to my previous brands, it’s a noticeable difference. Also, the stand/charger is super lightweight and it bothers me that a decent breeze is enough to topple it over. Really annoying when there’s no cap protecting the bristles- I don’t want it falling all over my bathroom! Going back, I’d probably try another brand. Not sure if I can return it since I used it, but may consider it if it’s an option.

It's a nicely looking toothbrush with polished handle.  Which makes it very slippery and difficult to use when it naturally becomes wet.  It supposed to have some additional features like timer etc. which don't work properly. If you need a basic model - go for Oral-B Pro 500.  If you need more advanced features - go for higher end model.  Either way there is no reason to buy this one.

I've used a Sonicare Essence toothbrush for years. I'm 3 years into my second. First Sonicare lasted 7 years! I purchased this Oral B because I wanted to be sure to get every little crevice in my mouth effectively (just in case the Sonicare doesn't). I planned to alternate this with my Sonicare. I had to return this. It rattled against my teeth noisily and the "motor" hesitated repeatedly while brushing. I realise it's supposed to let you know when to move the toothbrush but this was doing it every few seconds and in no discernable pattern. I concluded that it wasn't working properly. My Sonicare is actually much quieter, doesn't bounce off my teeth and does a better job. Using the two side by side, the difference is night and day. Besides, do I really need a toothbrush to tell me when to move it (even if properly working)? NO! I have no "interest" in either company. Just sharing my experience.

reviewTitle: Defective TImer and Really Loud like a hammer jack!
reviewDescription: Okay, I'm just being facetious about the Hammer Jack but it is loud!  Have been using an electric toothbrush for several years.  My current dental hygienist (who replaced my regular hygienist) suggested I switch to an Oral B.  So I bought this model.  Wanted something simple and didn't want to pay for an app I won't use.  First thing I noticed was the timer doesn't work.  About the 3rd time using it I just kept brushing while checking the clock.  After 4 minutes (still brushing my teeth), it still didn't time off.  I like the rotary aspect of the brush head but it is harder to get to my back teeth.  My usual model just had a regular head like a toothbrush.  It was so much quieter, too.  The Oral B does seem to do a good job cleaning but I've been using it only 2 or 3 times a week because it is really loud...much louder than a dentist drill which I hate...he uses the drill occasionally to smooth out my tooth.  The other issue is the rectangular hole on the head.  What is that for?  Eventually that is going to mold...so gross.  Between my old and the Oral B, I prefer the old because it is totally USB and lasts several weeks on a charge (brushing minimum twice a day).  I'll probably be taking the old one with me on my upcoming trip.  Even with the old electric toothbrush, I must be doing a good job brushing because I haven't had a single cavity over 40 years.  I've had a tooth chip twice (was told it was because I ate something cold and drank something hot right after--don't ever do that!).  Had fillings replaced twice, but no major dental work done (knock on wood!)  Not really happy with the Oral B but will continue to use it several times a week since it's not something that can be returned.

Compared to my last electric toothbrush this thing is loud and the vibrations are really rough. Seems to do the job though. Also there is a plug in stand for it that’s a pain. My last one didn’t have a stand and you could charge it off a little usb cord. Much more convenient. Expected more from Oral B.

Not high quality but it gets the job done. Not sure how long it will last as I’ve only had it about a month. Not good to compare to a high dollar toothbrush but you only have to hold it so it’s good enough. Will  spend more money on the next one I get.

It is doing the job expected the only real disagreement is with this press button on and off which is hard to press, not an instant off thing. Sometimes I need to press very hard to stop the brush working. Other than that, it is an ok product for the price.

For the money it is good. The battery life is poor. You need to keep this on the charger or in 12 hours battery would be weak. Also, very difficult to shut off. I purchased several months ago but now looking for one that is higher quality.

It’s a good product, definitely cleaned my teeth better than a regular non-electric toothbrush. However, I bought a black toothbrush and got sent a blue one instead, which is troublesome since my roommate has the exact same one. It’s annoying but I’m too lazy to return anyway…
My old electric toothbrush died so I got this one and although I feel it cleans my teeth well it doesn't hold a charge for long. I feel like I'm charging it before a full week has passed.
Pressure indicator is not visual and to be honest is imperceptible. I wish I did not buy it as pressure indicator of my brushing was the main reason I bough this.
Gets the job done.
Works well but it’s so loud! I had a different electric toothbrush prior to this one and it was significantly quieter than this one.

reviewTitle: Doesn’t hold charge as long as Philips Sonicare.
reviewDescription: After previously using Philips Sonicare I was disappointed to find that this particular toothbrush doesn’t hold a charge near as long. I have carpal tunnel and find this brush hard to turn off.
The brush cleansing part works very well however the on/off switch never works correctly. I am always pressing multiple areas to hit the right spot to turn on AND off.
The handle was smooth plastic and when wet it slipped in your hand so that it was hard to turn off. It needs some sort of ribbed rubber for better control.
After a month the battery seems losing  Harte capability. I have to charge twice a week instead  once. The head brush bristles starting opening sooner than expected.
I have had other Oral B electric toothbrushes and liked them but this one is just too noisy.  So I gave it away and purchased a different brand.

reviewTitle: I'm not excited about this switch from a manual toothbrush.
reviewDescription: My dentist recommended I switch to an electric toothbrush with a circular head to help reduce my receding gum line and tooth sensitivity. I ordered this toothbrush and was excited to give it a try.Overall, I don't love it. The instructions that came with it were clearly the same that they give with all models, so it was annoying because it would give different instructions for different model numbers- and this one wasn't one of the numbers given! It's not like it's super complicated... but it is annoying to have a product line that isn't shown in the instruction document.I don't like how noisy this toothbrush is. I have to get up before my partner on the weekdays. I asked him if the noise bothered him, and he said no, the only part that bothers him is when it goes a different speed. This is the 30 second interval timer that lets you know to switch quadrants. He doesn't mind the white noise of the toothbrush, but the different rhythm catches his attention when he's still trying to sleep. For myself, the noise overall is annoying. I also don't like that I feel like I can't spit anything out, because if I take the toothbrush out of my mouth, it's still going and will spray stuff everywhere. I find that I have to turn around and face away from the sink so I'm not tempted to spit.I also don't feel like I am able to get to the backs of my molars as easily as I could with my manual toothbrush. I have TMJ and have trouble opening my mouth wide. I have my first cleaning since starting with this toothbrush in a few weeks, so we'll see if the dentist notices any problems back there.Finally, I have to point out that this toothbrush is advertised as green in color. It is not green. It is blue. I thought that would be the case based on the photos in the listing, but I went with it anyhow. Buyer beware, if you care, this is NOT green. It is very much a turquoise teal sort of blue.
It deep cleans well on full charge. Batteries dont last long. Every three days I have to charge it. Charging time takes too long at least 24 hours.
Very noisy.  My dog runs away every time I use it.  If it was quieter, it would be a repurchase for me

reviewTitle: Noisy, vibrates, hidden settings, not user friendly
reviewDescription: It’s hard to adjust the various settings. Lots of noises and vibrations make brushing a bad experience. It jerks to tell the user to change quadrant. The on off button is supposed to control the various brushing actions but really don’t notice any difference from one setting to the other.  It seems like it never turns off unless you turn it off. How anyone is able to time brushing from quadrant to another beats me. It seems to clean your teeth but it’s not a pleasant experience. I guess like anything else it takes time to get used to this thing and understand its limited functions. For a device that has been around for many years I am not impressed with this poorly engineered electric toothbrush.  I also have a Sonicare electric toothbrush and it’s far more sophisticated and user friendly. Buy a waterpik to get between your teeth, floss daily, use a good mouthwash, and use good old fashioned tooth brush.

reviewTitle: It’s fine… not my fav electric toothbrush
reviewDescription: I previously had a sonicare electric toothbrush, so maybe I’m biased but this Oral B isn’t my favorite. I went with it because I thought I should try something new (and my Sonicare died after 3-4 years). It gets the job done; my teeth are probably clean. However, it’s loud, the toothbrush head is too big for my mouth so I have to keep my mouth open and toothpaste is falling out everywhere (it is hilarious to watch tho), and it feels cheaper overall. I’m told that there are “compact” brush heads, but I’ve been looking and I can’t find that description anywhere; however that could be on me. Also I think there is a timer, and it buzzes every 30 seconds. It doesn’t turn off after 2 minutes, so I’m a little confused by that feature. I’m a bit picky for sure, but I wouldn’t recommend this. :/

reviewTitle: Like the toothbrush however problem with charger
reviewDescription: toothbrush or my charger did not work correctly (toothbrush didn’t hold a charge )so and exchanging.. once that happens I’ll updat my review😊UPDATE .Not enough time to be definite but I told you I’d update you:) I’m really nervous about the charge ..seems to be a little erratic but I will update you soon😬👍In the meantime please see that the toothbrush many people are reviewing does NOTmatch the photo on The box that is shown on Amazon!  As far as this toothbrush which does match the photo👌UPDATE: I just found that there is another Oral-B Pro 1000, and that one does match the photos and videos of many of the reviews on Amazon!🙃 It’s more expensive than the one I’m reviewing and the easiest way to tell the difference is again it has to some of rectangular boxes at the bottom indicate charging levels where is the one on revealing only has one singular round very small.!👍its  NOT too loud for me.👍😖don’t think it’s less effective than the more expensive Electric Oral-B toothbrushes… I think it may be better cleaning than the genius toothbrush!However I find the most important thing is the actual oral B  Toothbrush heads that I use!!!Because there’s a problem with the charging that could either be the charger itself or the toothbrush.. I’m going to buy an exact replica and return this one and hope it was just a problem with charging with this particular one🙏🏻PS I DO LIKE THAT  this toothbrush does not have the bright Circular light that comes onWhether I’m brushing my teeth or not😮I had been LOOKING FORWARD to it so I wouldn’t brush Certain areas to hard.  However was shocked that it was giving me inaccurate feedback.. Heating I was doing a good job when I know it was brushing with Too much force‼️and even intentionally pressed hard but the light didn’t change Until the point I was pressing extremely hard.‼️really dislike that walking into a dark bathroom at night as soon as I touch the counter (the toothbrush lying there (aware not the greatest place for it but really not the worst cause it’s very clean )will come on automatically. This wouldn’t be a problem however in the circular light setting at the top is extremely bright😳😳😳When brushing my teeth not only was it not accurate it’s just so bright it really bothers me I’m sure it won’t bother some other people but I I find it visually irritating because it’s way too bright👎 what a disappointment.  So hopefully The new replacement  will be fine 🙏🏻And now know there’s two other oral B replaceable toothbrush heads are designed to be even more sensitive🙌🏻  I never heard of but thank goodness for Oral-B customer service👍👍👍 which was wonderful!I spent about half an hour on the phone with them Oh my questions were answered and I learned more helpful informationLike the toothbrush however problem with charger

reviewTitle: The brush is great but the presentation is terrible (Trust me you want to see more details)
reviewDescription: Ok so the brush works fine and dandy as a brush, cleans well, requires little to no elbow grease, and it's rechargeable, at least it feels like a solid brush (at time of review I've only used it for one session). The brush runs fine, bristles don't hurt my gums or cause any bleeding, all good there.So why am I writing a 3 star review for a product that so far from very limited use is solid? Like the title says, presentation. I'm not one for excessive packaging and wasteful boxes so that's not what I mean. What I mean is presentation of information. The included instructions are god awful and do a terrible job explaining how to use the product. The name of this product is the pro 1000 as far as I or anyone else knows and the box claims that there are 3 modes. Yet it does not explain which modes are included with this brush, how to activate the modes, and when activated there are no instructions to which mode is activated and no indication on the brush other than the speed and behavior of the pulses/rotation of the brush. The manual refers to "type" 3710, 3708, 3791 only, and 3791 pressure sensor when describing which modes are available to a brush and I assume all the various oral b models fall into these four categories but at I can only assume because there is no clear indication as to which this brush falls under unless the pictogram on the left refers to this brush. By the way the pictograms on the left are never explained or referred to in the instructions at any point, they're Ikea style pictograms except this isn't a product you need to put together and all parts just fit, this is a product that requires actual instructions. Like pictogram labeled 1, does that show that the light is shining when charging, or when full? What color? Or does it shine when just plugged an docked? How long do we need to charge? When do we know if it's full? All this is important so you don't degrade the battery and kill the brush in a few weeks. Doesn't even tell you how to cycle/activate the various modes let alone which mode is which.
Why is there a 3-speed control button...I should descriptions closer, I guess. I did not need that function. Not worth returning
It cleans my teeth great, and for that I love it! But it is so so loud!!

This toothbrush gets my teeth clean after every time I use it. I can tell it massages my gums when I am brushing my teeth. I can't really tell when it lets me know that I am brushing too hard on my teeth, maybe when it vibrates. I wish it would turn off and let me know that 2 minutes is up after I had brushed my teeth. I find it very annoying that I have to press the off button 3 times in order to turn off the toothbrush. lastly, I don't like how I have to keep on charging it in several days, now that can be very annoying, but overall, a nice toothbrush to have.

reviewTitle: Only had it for 2 years and it stopped working.
reviewDescription: Hello! I loved this toothbrush, it did an amazing job and I always felt so clean after each use.  Until I started to notice it wouldn’t turn on the first time pressing the bottom and one day it completely stopped working. I’ve been told that they can last 5+ years but I only used mine for about 2 years before it completed stopped turning on. Is there a way I can receive a refund or receive a new one? Please and thank you!

reviewTitle: Will keep for now but don't like
reviewDescription: I've used this brush now for about a month and I worry about it damaging my teeth. First, the round brush head is smaller than my old Oral B so I constantly hit my teeth with the hard plastic instead of the brush head. But, I'm getting better at it. The specifications say it has 3 speeds. Good luck using them. The on/off button is so hard to press that it's impossible to do anything but turn it on and off. To use the other speeds, you need to press the button once, twice or three times. Impossible to do. It's "on and off" because it takes so much pressure to push the button in the first place. As a result, my thumb has developed a significant pain from the button pushing. Also, I find the diameter of the handle to be way too big (and I have large hands). It's impossible to shift the toothbrush the way I'm accustomed to doing in my hand. Overall, I'm not happy with the purchase.
My dental hygienist recommended I change from Sonicare to Oral B, and I'm glad I did.  It does a great job!
I had no idea how much i WASN'T brushing my teeth. This Oral-B Pro 1000 makes my mouth and teeth feel like fresh from the dentist clean! It's amazing. Highly recommend

reviewTitle: great toothbrush, does much better job than regular
reviewDescription: cleans much better than my old regular toothbrush. feels like after going to dentist without the pain. don't use the timer, as far as I know it has no Bluetooth, don't know why you would need that anyway.
It reaches places other can’t.It feels awesome.It removes everything bad on the wayThree speedsThis product is highly recommended.

This toothbrush has done a great job, and I'm very happy with it. I would just say that I spend a good deal longer brushing than the timer function tells me too, but I've spent more time than the average person brushing.
Pretty powerful, timer is helpful to get the full brushing in. Love it so far. Probably the best toothbrush I’ve owned!
I love the strength of this. It does  a great job cleaning your teeth. I love the pink color too!
This is the best. Loved the one I bought so much I gifted my 2 adult sons and they whole heartedly agree
Used Braun forever it seems.  Did try another brand but it doesn't compare to any Braun chargers.  My only suggestion is to change brush heads when needed.
I like the gentle brush it comes with and it’s small and doesn’t take up a lot of room with charging

As a toothbrush it works well but it is very hard to hold. Unlike my old  Oral B, the grip is skinny and slick.  Once your hand gets wet, the toothbrush starts to slide out and the on-off switch is not as positive.  My old Oral B has a thicker grip which was rubbery and had ridges for a secure grip.  I can’t really recommend this product

Have been an Oral B user for over 20yrs and have been extremely pleased with rechargeable brushes. Until this one. The on/off botton is not easy to engage. With the 3 mode options delays turning it off more so.

reviewTitle: Works great but the battery life sucks!!!
reviewDescription: The brush itself has been great but for the past 8 months the battery life has continued to decline.  Very disappointing as I have only used for a couple years.  Having a replaceable battery would be great.
I liked the way the brush cleaned. The on/off switch is low quality. It is difficult to turn the unit off. There are three speeds so you have to push the button hard three times to turn it off.

reviewTitle: This is terrible compared to the Philips Sonicare
reviewDescription: Where to start. Instructions are terrible, and don't even cover this model correctly.  The timer thing never shuts off. YOu get the thirty second warning so you can switch for each part of the mouth. But after 4 cycles, it never shuts off. You have to futz with the slimy small button and push it 3 times to turn off.  Absolutely terrible design, and the button had no texture, so its easy to miss.The Philips works so much better, should have just bought another one, even though far more expensive.The oral b also operates with an awful grinding feeling, the philips is a nice buzz.  Dont recommend,

I bought this to replace an older Oral B. Like many others have commented, it is hard to turn on and off. There is absolutely no excuse for Oral B to put this on the market KNOWING it was hard. Folks, this is where they get the phrase PROFIT OVER PEOPLE! I'm sure the company must have saved money by putting in a cheap, hard to press switch. I'll never buy another Oral B!
It's very hard on the gums, yet doesnt clean as well as a manual toothbrush...

While it will "last" a week off the charger, it clearly loses power after 2 uses and slows the more you use it. The only way to get full strength is to keep it on the charger every day. Probably not worth the premium when there are similar or off brand products for much less that couldn't perform worse

I bought this to replace our Sonicare when it broke based on Wirecutter reviews and really regret it. It's cheaper yes, but it is so incredibly loud and the timer function is more annoying than my Sonicare was. When this eventually breaks I will definitely be going back to Sonicare, it was worth the extra money, in my opinion.

reviewTitle: Making weird noises and goes on and off
reviewDescription: When I first got this I was obsessed my teeth have never felt cleaner I spent so much money on other toothbrushes and I loved my fairywill but I have been dying to try in Oral-B because it spins also so I purchased this even with a high price I used it right away it is very loud but it worked great until three days ago. Now my brush is always fully charged it started making really loud kinda like grinding noises which wasn’t normal and then it shut off completely I was like OK so I put it on the charger for a bit used  a different toothbrush wondering maybe my kids took it off the charger port and then put it back and I didn’t know so I tried it again it did it again and the tip started shaking so I took it off I put it back on and it is just not working right oddly it makes me a little nervous like it’s gonna explode in my hand which obviously I know that it won’t well I hope I don’t think it would but that’s kind of what it feels like and sounds like like. I want to contact OralB I don’t see that option and the Amazon help doesn’t have the option of help that I need for this so I’m hoping that someone from the company will reach out to me. Will update review

Holy cow. Thank goodness you can use it in the shower - otherwise it wakes up the whole house. Both my cats thought it was a vacuum cleaner and still haven’t come out from under the bed. Aside from that it’s a good affordable brush.

reviewTitle: Not working / Crazy hoops to jump through for help
reviewDescription: I’m sure it’s a nice toothbrush if it works properly. I Gave it a full charge and used it. The brush head stops like every 20 seconds. Figured it was the pressure sensor. Took it out of my mouth and ran it. The brush still stops. Amazon can’t do anything with it because it’s from Oral-B and Oral-B want me to sent it to one of there 4 service centers in the US. And wait over a month to see if it can be fixed or replaced. Guess I’ll try the Panasonic

I bought this because my prior Oral-B ran like a champ for years and this accepts common brush heads. However, this unit is lacking because:1. The black body is shiny and slick. It easily slips out of your hand when it is wet.2. The switch or some other electrical element flails when the unit is turned upside down for rinsing. Every time, it slows and stutters almost to a stop before continuing to run.
The head is too small. The ergonomics are awful. Big heavy poorly shaped handle tiny little neck and the power button is hard to find

Purchased based off a wire cutter review. Initial impression of the toothbrush was positive. It’s simple and it cleans. About three days in, the light started flashing red indicating a low battery. After fulling charging overnight, I was surprised to feel a noticeably weaker speed 3 days after and then see the same red flashing one day after that. I use the toothbrush for 2 minutes, twice a day.Unless you are fine with just leaving the brush in the charger (not an option with how my bathroom is laid out), then I would pass on this product. Tried the Burst electric toothbrush a few months later and it goes up to 4 weeks between charges for around the same price as this.

We have a few of Oral B Braun’s earlier toothbrushes. The battery is so great - showing full, medium, and low battery with a series of three lights. It’s a clear indication of when you need to charge it - DUH. It’s necessary, especially with kids. This new one doesn’t have that. WHY. To save money? It’s certainly not more convenient. This toothbrush is also not lighting up when it’s on the charger, so I think there may be an issue with it. So far, I’m unimpressed by their updated version. HIGHLY disappointed.

reviewTitle: It’s not a very effective clean
reviewDescription: I really wanted to like this product. However, now that I’ve had it for a little over a month the first one I had to return because the battery wouldn’t charge properly. And this one even if I spend more than the a lot of time, trying to get a good clean, my teeth, still feel dirty like I have to go back with manual tool to scrape at the leftover plaque. Just as effective as the old electric brush I had. Pretty disappointed.
The 2 minute timer doesn't work, needs charging every 2 days, but it does really clean your teeth

This is my third Oral-B brush. I bought a pair about eight years ago for my wife and I. She didn’t like hers so I wore both of them out.  I was thinking the new one would be improved, but no. The thing is even more slippery than the old ones. Then instead of adding a textured surface, they decided to make the switch twice as long, recess it and make you press it three times on the end to turn it off. I don’t think I will buy another.

reviewTitle: Not for those with small mouths
reviewDescription: After researching toothbrushes for an embarrassing amount of time, I purchased this brush because it was recommended as a good, basic budget brush. After using it a four or five times, I am unimpressed. This is no different than the $5 battery-operated models. It has no features, besides off/on and stopping when there is too much pressure. No timer ever was present; the "brush modes" do not exist on this model; and after a day and a half of charging, it still isn't fully charged. What's confusing is that the user manual says these features are on the model. It wasn't until I looked into reviews that I learned the manual is a "one-size-fits-all" one Oral-B uses for all its models.The thing that is mostly influencing a return of this item is that the brush head is large and clunky, and difficult to fit into and use in tight spaces. I am a petite person, with a small mouth; it was very difficult to get this around my back molars. I didn't feel like the result was as clean as my former Sonicare brush, which does have a smaller head. Also, the brush head vibrates like crazy and the brush is pretty hard. If I could get this back in the area, it was pretty rough brushing, or the tight fit triggered the pressure sensor to turn the brush off. All in all, this just didn't work for me.
